verses.latin: Liber generationis Iesu Christi, filii David, filii Abraham.
verses.english: This is the book of the ancestry of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, son of Abraham.

verses.latin: Abraham genuit Isaac: Isaac autem genuit Iacob: Iacob autem genuit Iudam et fratres eius:
verses.english: Abraham was the father of Isaac. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers:

verses.latin: Iudas autem genuit Phares et Zaram de Thamar: Phares autem genuit Esrom: Esrom autem genuit Aram:
verses.english: Judah was the father of Phares and Zaram. Their mother was Thamar. Phares was the father of Esrom. Esrom was the father of Aram:

verses.latin: Aram autem genuit Aminadab: Aminadab autem genuit Naasson: Naasson autem genuit Salmon:
verses.english: Aram was the father of Aminadab. Aminadab was the father of Naasson. Naasson was the father of Salmon:

verses.latin: Salmon autem genuit Booz ex Rahab: Booz autem genuit Obed ex Ruth: Obed autem genuit Iesse:
verses.english: Salmon was the father of Booz, whose mother was Rahab. Booz was the father of Obed, whose mother was Ruth. Obed was the father of Jesse:

verses.latin: Iesse autem genuit David regem: David autem rex genuit Salomonem ex ea quae fuit Uriæ:
verses.english: Jesse was the father of King David. King David was the father of Solomon, whose mother was the wife of Uriah:

verses.latin: Salomon autem genuit Roboam: Roboam autem genuit Abiam: Abia autem genuit Asa:
verses.english: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam was the father of Abijah. Abijah was the father of Asa:

verses.latin: Asa autem genuit Iosaphat: Iosaphat autem genuit Ioram: Ioram autem genuit Oziam:
verses.english: Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram. Joram was the father of Uzziah:

verses.latin: Ozias autem genuit Ioatham: Ioatham autem genuit Achaz: Achaz autem genuit Ezechiæ:
verses.english: Uzziah was the father of Jotham. Jotham was the father of Ahaz. Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah:

verses.latin: Ezechiæ autem genuit Manasse: Manasse autem genuit Amon: Amon autem genuit Iosiam:
verses.english: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amos. Amos was the father of Josiah:

verses.latin: Iosias autem genuit Iechoniam et fratres eius in transmigratione Babylonis.
verses.english: Josiah was the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.

verses.latin: Post transmigrationem autem Babylonis, Iechonias genuit Salathiël: Salathiël autem genuit Zorobabel:
verses.english: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah was the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel:

verses.latin: Zorobabel autem genuit Abiud: Abiud autem genuit Eliacim: Eliacim autem genuit Azor:
verses.english: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud. Abiud was the father of Eliakim. Eliakim was the father of Azor:

verses.latin: Azor autem genuit Sadoc: Sadoc autem genuit Achim: Achim autem genuit Eliud:
verses.english: Azor was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Achim. Achim was the father of Eliud:

verses.latin: Eliud autem genuit Eleazar: Eleazar autem genuit Mathan: Mathan autem genuit Iacob:
verses.english: Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eleazar was the father of Matthan. Matthan was the father of Jacob:

verses.latin: Iacob autem genuit Ioseph virum Mariæ, de qua natus est Iesus, qui vocatur Christus.
verses.english: Jacob was the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, and Mary was the mother of Jesus, who is called Christ.

verses.latin: Omnes igitur generationes, a Abraham usque ad David, generationes quatuordecim: et a David usque ad transmigrationem Babylonis, generationes quatuordecim: et a transmigratione Babylonis usque ad Christum, generationes quatuordecim.
verses.english: Thus there were fourteen generations from Abraham to David, fourteen generations from David to the exile to Babylon, and fourteen generations from the exile to Christ.

verses.latin: Christi autem generatio sic erat: Cum esset Maria mater eius desponsata Ioseph, antequam convenirent, inventa est in utero habens de Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: This is how Jesus Christ was born. His mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, but before they were married, she became pregnant through the power of the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Ioseph autem vir eius, cum esset iustus, et nollet eam traducere, voluit occulte dimittere eam.
verses.english: Because Joseph was a righteous man and did not want to publicly disgrace her, he decided to quietly divorce her.

verses.latin: Hæc autem eo cogitante, ecce angelus Domini apparuit ei in somnis, dicens: Ioseph, fili David, noli timere accipere Mariam coniugem tuam: quod enim in ea natum est, de Spiritu Sancto est.
verses.english: But as he considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Pariet autem filium: et vocabis nomen eius Iesum: ipse enim salvum faciet populum suum a peccatis eorum.
verses.english: She will give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem totum factum est, ut adimpleretur quod dictum est a Domino per prophetam dicentem:
verses.english: All of this took place to fulfill what the Lord had said through the prophet:

verses.latin: Ecce virgo in utero habebit, et pariet filium: et vocabunt nomen eius Emmanuel, quod est interpretatum, Nobiscum Deus.
verses.english: “Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel,” which means, “God with us.”

verses.latin: Excitatus autem a somno Ioseph, fecit sicut præcepit ei angelus Domini, et accepit uxorem suam.
verses.english: When Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him. He took Mary as his wife.

verses.latin: Et non cognoscebat eam donec peperit filium suum primogenitum: et vocavit nomen eius Iesum.
verses.english: But he did not know her as a husband until she gave birth to a son, and he named him Jesus.

verses.latin: Cum autem natus esset Iesus in Bethleem Iudaeae, in diebus Herodis regis, ecce Magi a solis ortu venerunt Ierosolymam,
verses.english: When Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea during the reign of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,

verses.latin: dicentes: Ubi est, qui natus est rex Iudaeorum? Vidimus enim stellam ejus in Oriente, et venimus adorare eum.
verses.english: saying, “Where is he who has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”

verses.latin: Audiens autem Herodes rex, turbatus est, et omnis Ierosolyma cum illo.
verses.english: King Herod heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

verses.latin: Et congregans omnes principes sacerdotum, et scribas populi, sciscitabatur ab eis ubi Christus nasceretur.
verses.english: He assembled all the chief priests and scribes of the people, and inquired of them where the Christ was to be born.

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: In Bethleem Iudaeae. Sic enim scriptum est per prophetam:
verses.english: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea.” For so it is written by the prophet:

verses.latin: Et tu Bethleem terra Iuda, nequaquam minima es in principibus Iuda: ex te enim exiet dux, qui regat populum meum Israel.
verses.english: “And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you shall come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.”

verses.latin: Tunc Herodes, clam vocatis Magis, diligenter didicit ab eis tempus stellae, quae apparuit eis:
verses.english: Then Herod secretly called the wise men and learned from them the time when the star had appeared.

verses.latin: et mittens illos in Bethleem, dixit: Ite, et interrogate diligenter de puero: et cum inveneritis, renuntiate mihi, ut et ego veniens adore eum.
verses.english: And he sent them to Bethlehem, saying, “Go and search diligently for the child; and when you have found him, bring me word, that I too may come and worship him.”

verses.latin: Qui cum audissent regem, abierunt: et ecce stella, quam viderant in Oriente, antecedebat eos, usque dum veniens staret supra, ubi erat puer.
verses.english: When they had heard the king, they went their way; and lo, the star which they had seen in the east went before them, till it came to rest over the place where the child was.

verses.latin: Videte autem stellam gavisi sunt gaudio magno valde.
verses.english: When they saw the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great joy.

verses.latin: Et intrantes domum, viderunt puerum cum Maria matre ejus, et procidentes adoraverunt eum: et apertis thesauris suis, obtulerunt ei munera, aurum, thus, et myrrham.
verses.english: And going into the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Then, opening their treasures, they offered him gifts, gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

verses.latin: Et responso accepto in somnis, ne redirent ad Herodem, per aliam viam reversi sunt in regionem suam.
verses.english: And being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they departed to their own country by another way.

verses.latin: Qui abierunt, ecce angelus Domini apparuit in somnis Ioseph, dicens: Surge, et accipe puerum et matrem ejus, et fuge in Aegyptum, et esto ibi usque dum dicam tibi. Futurum est enim ut Herodes quaerat puerum ad perdendum eum.
verses.english: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you; for Herod is going to search for the child to destroy him.”

verses.latin: Qui consurgens accepit puerum et matrem ejus nocte, et secessit in Aegyptum:
verses.english: So he got up, took the child and his mother by night, and went to Egypt,

verses.latin: et erat ibi usque ad obitum Herodis: ut adimpleretur quod dictum est a Domino per prophetam dicentem: Ex Aegypto vocavi filium meum.
verses.english: and remained there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what the Lord had spoken by the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

verses.latin: Tunc Herodes, videns quoniam illusus esset a Magis, iratus est valde, et mittens occidit omnes pueros, qui erant in Bethleem, et in omnibus finibus ejus, a binis annis et infra, secundum tempus, quod diligenter didicerat a Magis.
verses.english: Then when Herod saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, he became very enraged, and sent and slew all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all its vicinity, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had determined from the wise men.

verses.latin: Tunc adimpletum est quod dictum est per Ieremiam prophetam dicentem:
verses.english: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

verses.latin: Vox in Rama audita est, ploratus et ululatus multus: Rachel plorans filios suos, et noluit consolari, quia non sunt.
verses.english: “A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and loud lamentation, Rachel weeping for her children; and she refused to be comforted, because they are no more.”

verses.latin: Defuncto autem Herode, ecce angelus Domini apparuit in somnis Ioseph in Aegypto,
verses.english: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

verses.latin: dicens: Surge, et accipe puerum et matrem ejus, et vade in terram Israel: defuncti sunt enim qui quaerebant animam pueri.
verses.english: saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the child’s life are dead.”

verses.latin: Qui consurgens accepit puerum et matrem ejus, et venit in terram Israel.
verses.english: So he got up, took the child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

verses.latin: Audiens autem quod Archelaus regnaret in Iudaea pro Herode patre suo, timuit illuc ire: et monitus in somnis, secessit in partes Galilaeae.
verses.english: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there; and being warned in a dream, he withdrew to the region of Galilee,

verses.latin: Et veniens habitavit in civitate quae vocatur Nazareth: ut adimpleretur quod dictum est per prophetas: Quoniam Nazaraeus vocabitur.
verses.english: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth, that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled, that he would be called a Nazarene.

verses.latin: In diebus illis venit Ioannes Baptista praedicans in deserto Iudaeae,
verses.english: At that time, John the Baptist came, preaching in the desert of Judea,

verses.latin: et dicens: Paenitentiam agite: appropinquavit enim regnum caelorum.
verses.english: and saying, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand!"

verses.latin: Iste est enim de quo dictum est per Isaiam prophetam dicentem: Vox clamantis in deserto: Parate viam Domini, rectas facite semitas ejus.
verses.english: For this is the one about whom the prophet Isaiah spoke, saying: 'The voice of one crying in the desert, prepare the way of the Lord, make straight His paths.'

verses.latin: Ipse autem Ioannes habebat vestimentum de pilis camelorum, et zonam pelliceam circa lumbos suos: esca autem ejus erat lucustae et mel silvestre.
verses.english: Now John himself wore a garment made of camel's hair, and a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

verses.latin: Tunc exibat ad eum Ierusalem, et omnis Iudaea, et omnis regio circa Iordanem,
verses.english: Then Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan River went out to him,

verses.latin: et baptizabantur ab eo in Iordane flumine, confitentes peccata sua.
verses.english: and were baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.

verses.latin: Videns autem multos pharisaeos et sadducaeos venientes ad baptismum suum, dixit eis: Progenies viperarum, quis demonstravit vobis fugere a ventura ira?
verses.english: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

verses.latin: Facite ergo fructum dignum paenitentiae.
verses.english: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance.

verses.latin: Et ne velitis dicere intra vos: Patrem habemus Abraham. Dico enim vobis quia potest Deus de lapidibus istis suscitare filios Abrahae.
verses.english: And do not presume to say to yourselves, 'We have Abraham as our father.' For I say to you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones.

verses.latin: Iam enim securis ad radicem arborum posita est. Omnis ergo arbor, quae non facit fructum bonum, excidetur, et in ignem mittetur.
verses.english: And now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

verses.latin: Ego quidem baptizo vos in aqua in paenitentiam: qui autem post me venturus est fortior me est, cujus non sum dignus calceamenta portare: ipse vos baptizabit in Spiritu Sancto et igni:
verses.english: I baptize you with water for repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.

verses.latin: cujus ventilabrum in manu sua: et purgabit aream suam: et congregabit triticum in horreum suum, paleas autem comburet igni inextinguibili.
verses.english: His winnowing fork is in His hand, and He will thoroughly cleanse His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into the barn; but He will burn the chaff with unquenchable fire."

verses.latin: Tunc venit Iesus a Galilaea in Iordanem ad Ioannem, ut baptizaretur ab eo.
verses.english: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

verses.latin: Ioannes autem prohibebat eum, dicens: Ego a te necesse habeo baptizari, et tu venis ad me?
verses.english: But John tried to prevent Him, saying, "I need to be baptized by You, and do You come to me?"

verses.latin: Respondens autem Iesus, dixit ei: Sine modo: sic enim decet nos implere omnem iustitiam. Tunc dimisit eum.
verses.english: But Jesus answered and said to him, "Permit it now, for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness." Then he allowed Him.

verses.latin: Et baptizatus, confestim ascendit de aqua: et ecce aperti sunt ei caeli: et vidit Spiritum Dei descendentem sicut columbam, et venientem super se.
verses.english: When He had been baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting upon Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce vox de caelis dicens: Hic est Filius meus dilectus, in quo mihi complacui.
verses.english: And suddenly a voice came from heaven, saying, "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."

verses.latin: Tunc ductus est Jesus in desertum a Spiritu, ut tentaretur a diabolo.
verses.english: Then the Holy Spirit sent Jesus to the desert to be tested by the devil.

verses.latin: Et cum jejunasset quadraginta diebus et quadraginta noctibus, postea esuriit.
verses.english: After fasting for forty days and forty nights, He became hungry.

verses.latin: Et accedens tentator, dixit ei: Si Filius Dei es, dic ut lapides isti panes fiant.
verses.english: The tempter then came to Him, and said, "If You are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread."

verses.latin: Qui respondens, dixit: Scriptum est: Non in solo pane vivit homo, sed in omni verbo, quod procedit de ore Dei.
verses.english: But Jesus responded: "The Scriptures say, 'Man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.'"

verses.latin: Tunc assumpsit eum diabolus in sanctam civitatem, et statuit eum super pinnaculum templi,
verses.english: Then the devil took Him to the holy city, and set Him on the pinnacle of the temple,

verses.latin: et dixit ei: Si Filius Dei es, mitte te deorsum; scriptum est enim: Quia angelis suis mandavit de te, ut tollant te in manibus, ne forte offendas ad lapidem pedem tuum.
verses.english: saying, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down, because it is written, 'He will command His angels concerning you.' And 'On their hands they will bear you up, lest at any time you dash your foot against a stone.'

verses.latin: Ait illi Jesus: Rursum scriptum est: Non tentabis Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, "Again, it is written, 'You shall not tempt the Lord your God.'

verses.latin: Iterum assumpsit eum diabolus in montem excelsum valde: et ostendit ei omnia regna mundi, et gloriam eorum,
verses.english: Again, the devil took Him to a very high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory,

verses.latin: et dixit ei: Haec omnia tibi dabo, si cadens adoraveris me.
verses.english: and said to Him, "All these things I will give You if You fall down and worship me."

verses.latin: Tunc dicit ei Jesus: Vade, Satana: scriptum est enim: Dominum Deum tuum adorabis, et illi soli servies.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to him, "Go away, Satan! For it is written, 'You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only you shall serve.'

verses.latin: Tunc reliquit eum diabolus: et ecce angeli accesserunt, et ministrabant ei.
verses.english: Then the devil left Him, and angels came and ministered to Him.

verses.latin: Cum autem audisset Jesus quod Joannes traditus esset, secessit in Galilaeam:
verses.english: But when Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, He departed to Galilee.

verses.latin: et relicta Nazareth, venit et habitavit in Capharnaum maritima, in finibus Zabulon et Nepthalim:
verses.english: And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali,

verses.latin: ut adimpleretur quod dictum est per Isaiam prophetam dicentem:
verses.english: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet Isaiah, saying:

verses.latin: Terra Zabulon, et terra Nepthalim, via maris trans Jordanem, Galilaea gentium:
verses.english: 'The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, the way of the sea beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

verses.latin: populus, qui sedebat in tenebris, lucem vidit magnam: et his, qui sedebant in regione et umbra mortis, lux orta est eis.
verses.english: the people who sat in darkness have seen a great light, and upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death, light has dawned.'

verses.latin: Exinde coepit Jesus praedicare, et dicere: Paenitentiam agite: appropinquavit enim regnum caelorum.
verses.english: From that time, Jesus began to preach and to say, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand."

verses.latin: Ambulans autem juxta mare Galilaeae, vidit duos fratres, Simonem, qui dicitur Petrus, et Andream fratrem ejus, mittentes retia in mare (erant enim piscatores).
verses.english: And walking by the Sea of Galilee, He saw two brothers, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Venite post me, et faciam vos piscatores hominum.
verses.english: And He said to them, "Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men."

verses.latin: At illi, continuo relictis retibus, secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And immediately they left their nets and followed Him.

verses.latin: Et procedens inde, vidit alios duos fratres, Jacobum Zebedaei, et Joannem fratrem ejus, in navi cum Zebedaeo patre eorum, reficientes retia sua: et vocavit eos.
verses.english: And going on from there, He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. And He called them.

verses.latin: At illi, statim relictis retibus et patre, secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And immediately they left the nets and their father, and followed Him.

verses.latin: Et circuibat Jesus totam Galilaeam, docens in synagogis eorum, et praedicans Evangelium regni: et sanans omnem languorem, et omnem infirmitatem in populo.
verses.english: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease among the people.

verses.latin: Et exiit fama ejus in totam Syriam, et obtulerunt ei omnes male habentes, variis languoribus et tormentis comprehensos, et qui daemonia habebant, et lunaticos, et paralyticos, et curavit eos:
verses.english: Then His fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought to Him all sick people who were afflicted with various diseases and torments, and those who were demon-possessed, epileptics, and paralytics; and He healed them.

verses.latin: et secutae sunt eum turbae multae de Galilaea, et Decapoli, et de Jerosolymis, et de Judaea, et de trans Jordanem.
verses.english: And great multitudes followed Him from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

verses.latin: Videns autem turbas, ascendit in montem: et cum sedisset, accesserunt ad eum discipuli ejus,
verses.english: Seeing the crowds, He went up onto the mountain, and when He sat down, His disciples gathered around Him.

verses.latin: et aperiens os suum docebat eos, dicens:
verses.english: Opening His mouth, He taught them, saying:

verses.latin: Beati pauperes spiritu: quoniam ipsorum est regnum caelorum.
verses.english: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

verses.latin: Beati mites: quoniam ipsi possidebunt terram.
verses.english: Blessed are the meek: for they shall possess the earth.

verses.latin: Beati qui lugent: quoniam ipsi consolabuntur.
verses.english: Blessed are they who mourn: for they shall be comforted.

verses.latin: Beati qui esuriunt et sitiunt justitiam: quoniam ipsi saturabuntur.
verses.english: Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness: for they shall have their fill.

verses.latin: Beati misericordes: quoniam ipsi misericordiam consequentur.
verses.english: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

verses.latin: Beati mundo corde: quoniam ipsi Deum videbunt.
verses.english: Blessed are the clean of heart: for they shall see God.

verses.latin: Beati pacifici: quoniam filii Dei vocabuntur.
verses.english: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

verses.latin: Beati qui persecutionem patiuntur propter justitiam: quoniam ipsorum est regnum caelorum.
verses.english: Blessed are they who suffer persecution for justice's sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

verses.latin: Beati estis cum maledixerint vobis, et persecuti vos fuerint, et dixerint omne malum adversum vos mentientes, propter me:
verses.english: Blessed are you when they shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you, falsely, for My sake:

verses.latin: gaudete et exsultate, quoniam merces vestra copiosa est in caelis. Sic enim persecuti sunt prophetas, qui fuerunt ante vos.
verses.english: Be glad and rejoice, for your reward is very great in heaven. For so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

verses.latin: Vos estis sal terrae. Quod si sal evanuerit, in quo salietur? ad nihilum valet ultra, nisi ut mittatur foras, et conculcetur ab hominibus.
verses.english: You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its savor, with what shall it be salted? It is good for nothing anymore but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

verses.latin: Vos estis lux mundi. Non potest civitas abscondi supra montem posita;
verses.english: You are the light of the world. A city set on a mountain cannot be hidden.

verses.latin: neque accendunt lucernam, et ponunt eam sub modio, sed super candelabrum, ut luceat omnibus qui in domo sunt.
verses.english: Neither do they light a lamp and put it under a basket, but upon a lampstand, that it may shine to all who are in the house.

verses.latin: sic luceat lux vestra coram hominibus, ut videant opera vestra bona, et glorificent Patrem vestrum qui in caelis est.
verses.english: So let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

verses.latin: Nolite putare quoniam veni solvere legem, aut prophetas: non veni solvere, sed adimplere.
verses.english: Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets: I have not come to abolish, but to fulfill.

verses.latin: Amen quippe dico vobis, donec transeat caelum et terra, jota unum aut unus apex non praeteribit a lege, donec omnia fiant.
verses.english: For truly I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle shall not pass from the law, till all things are accomplished.

verses.latin: Qui ergo solverit unum de mandatis istis minimis, et docuerit sic homines, minimus vocabitur in regno caelorum: qui autem fecerit et docuerit, hic magnus vocabitur in regno caelorum.
verses.english: Whoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but he that shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, quia nisi abundaverit justitia vestra plus quam scribarum et pharisaeorum, non intrabitis in regnum caelorum.
verses.english: For I say unto you, that unless your justice abound more than that of the scribes and Pharisees, you shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

verses.latin: Audistis quia dictum est antiquis: Non occides: qui autem occiderit, reus erit judicii.
verses.english: You have heard that it was said to them of old: Thou shalt not kill; and whoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis quia omnis qui irascitur fratri suo, reus erit judicii. Qui autem dixerit fratri suo, Raca: reus erit concilio. Qui autem dixerit, Fatue: reus erit gehennae ignis.
verses.english: But I say to you, that whoever is angry with his brother shall be in danger of the judgment. And whoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council. And whoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

verses.latin: Si ergo offeres munus tuum ad altare, et ibi recordatus fueris quia frater tuus habet aliquid adversum te:
verses.english: If therefore you offer your gift at the altar, and there you remember that your brother has something against you:

verses.latin: relinque ibi munus tuum ante altare, et vade prius reconciliari fratri tuo: et tunc veniens offeres munus tuum.
verses.english: leave your gift before the altar, and go first to be reconciled to your brother; and then coming you shall offer your gift.

verses.latin: Esto consentiens adversario tuo cito dum es in via cum eo: ne forte tradat te adversarius judici, et judex tradat te ministro, et in carcerem mittaris.
verses.english: Be at agreement with your adversary quickly, while you are in the way with him: lest perhaps the adversary deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.

verses.latin: Amen dico tibi, non exies inde, donec solvas novissimum quadrantem.
verses.english: Amen I say to you, you shall not go out from thence, till you repay the last farthing.

verses.latin: Audistis quia dictum est antiquis: Non moechaberis.
verses.english: You have heard that it was said to them of old: Thou shalt not commit adultery.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis, quia omnis qui viderit mulierem ad concupiscendum eam, jam moechatus est eam in corde suo.
verses.english: But I say to you, that whoever looks at a woman to lust after her, has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

verses.latin: Quod si oculus tuus dexter scandalizat te, erue eum, et projice abs te: expedit enim tibi ut pereat unum membrorum tuorum, quam totus corpus tuum mittatur in gehennam.
verses.english: And if thy right eye scandalizes thee, pluck it out and cast it from thee: for it is expedient for thee that one of thy members should perish, rather than that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

verses.latin: Et si manus tua dextra scandalizat te, abscide eam, et projice abs te: expedit tibi ut pereat unum membrorum tuorum, quam totum corpus tuum eat in gehennam.
verses.english: And if thy right hand scandalizes thee, cut it off and cast it from thee: for it is expedient for thee that one of thy members should perish, rather than that thy whole body should go into hell.

verses.latin: Dictum est autem: Quicumque dimiserit uxorem suam, det ei libellum repudii.
verses.english: And it hath been said: Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorce.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis, quia omnis qui dimiserit uxorem suam, absque causa fornicationis, facit eam moechari: et qui dimissam duxerit, moechatur.
verses.english: But I say to you, that whoever shall put away his wife, except for the cause of fornication, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever shall marry her who is put away, commits adultery.

verses.latin: Iterum audistis quia dictum est antiquis: Non perjurabis: reddes autem Domino juramenta tua.
verses.english: Again you have heard that it was said to them of old: Thou shalt not forswear thyself; but thou shalt perform thy oaths to the Lord.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis, non jurare omnino, neque per caelum, quia thronus Dei est:
verses.english: But I say to you not to swear at all, neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God:

verses.latin: neque per terram, quia scabellum est pedum ejus: neque per Jerusalem, quia civitas est magni regis:
verses.english: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet: nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great king:

verses.latin: neque jurabis per caput tuum, quia non potes unum capillum album facere, aut nigrum.
verses.english: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

verses.latin: Sit autem sermo vester, Est, est: non, non: quod autem his est amplius, a malo est.
verses.english: But let your speech be, Yes, yes: No, no: and that which is over and above these, is of evil.

verses.latin: Audistis quia dictum est: Oculum pro oculo, et dentem pro dente.
verses.english: You have heard that it hath been said: An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis, non resistere malo: sed si quis te percusserit in dextera maxilla tua, praebe illi et alteram:
verses.english: But I say to you not to resist evil: but if anyone strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him also the other:

verses.latin: et ei qui vult tecum judicio contendere, et tunicam tuam tollere, dimitte ei et pallium:
verses.english: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let go thy cloak also:

verses.latin: et quicumque te angariaverit mille passus, vade cum eo et alia duo.
verses.english: And whosoever shall force thee to go one mile, go with him two.

verses.latin: Qui petit a te, da ei: et volenti mutuari a te, ne avertaris.
verses.english: Give to him that asks of thee; and from him that would borrow of thee turn not away.

verses.latin: Audistis quia dictum est: Diliges proximum tuum, et odio habebis inimicum tuum.
verses.english: You have heard that it hath been said: Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and hate thy enemy.

verses.latin: Ego autem dico vobis: Diligite inimicos vestros: benefacite his qui oderunt vos: et orate pro persequentibus et calumniantibus vos:
verses.english: But I say to you, Love your enemies: do good to them that hate you: and pray for them that persecute and calumniate you:

verses.latin: ut sitis filii Patris vestri qui in caelis est: qui solem suum facit oriri super bonos et malos: et pluit super justos et injustos.
verses.english: That you may be the children of your Father who is in heaven: who makes his sun to rise upon the good and the bad, and rains upon the just and the unjust.

verses.latin: Si enim diligatis eos qui vos diligunt, quam mercedem habebitis? nonne et publicani hoc faciunt?
verses.english: For if you love those who love you, what reward shall you have? Do not even the publicans do the same?

verses.latin: Et si salutaveritis fratres vestros tantum, quid amplius facitis? nonne et ethnici hoc faciunt?
verses.english: And if you salute your brethren only, what do you more? Do not also the heathens do the same?

verses.latin: Estote ergo vos perfecti, sicut et Pater vester caelestis perfectus est.
verses.english: Be you therefore perfect, as also your heavenly Father is perfect.

verses.latin: Attendite ne iustitiam vestram faciatis coram hominibus, ut videamini ab eis: alioquin mercedem non habebitis apud Patrem vestrum qui in caelis est.
verses.english: Be careful not to display your piety merely to be seen by others. Otherwise, you will get no reward from your Father in heaven.

verses.latin: Cum ergo facis eleemosynam, noli tuba canere ante te, sicut hypocritae faciunt in synagogis et vicis, ut honorificentur ab hominibus. Amen dico vobis, receperunt mercedem suam.
verses.english: So when you give alms, do not announce it with trumpets as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be praised by men. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

verses.latin: Te autem faciente eleemosynam, nesciat sinistra tua quid faciat dextera tua,
verses.english: But when you give alms, let not your left hand know what your right hand is doing,

verses.latin: ut sit eleemosyna tua in abscondito: et Pater tuus, qui videt in abscondito, reddet tibi.
verses.english: so that your alms may be in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will repay you.

verses.latin: Et cum oratis, non eritis sicut hypocritae qui amant in synagogis et in angulis platearum stantes orare, ut videantur ab hominibus. Amen dico vobis, receperunt mercedem suam.
verses.english: And when you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites, who love to stand and pray in the synagogues and at the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

verses.latin: Tu autem cum orabis, intra in cubiculum tuum, et clauso ostio, ora Patrem tuum in abscondito: et Pater tuus, qui videt in abscondito, reddet tibi.
verses.english: But when you pray, go into your room and shut your door and pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will repay you.

verses.latin: Orantes autem, nolite multum loqui, sicut ethnici: putant enim quod in multiloquio suo exaudiantur.
verses.english: And when you pray, do not heap up empty phrases as the Gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard for their many words.

verses.latin: Nolite ergo similia eis: scit enim Pater vester quid opus sit vobis, antequam petatis eum.
verses.english: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.

verses.latin: Sic ergo vos orabitis: Pater noster, qui es in caelis, sanctificetur nomen tuum.
verses.english: Pray then like this: “Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name.

verses.latin: Adveniat regnum tuum: fiat voluntas tua, sicut in caelo et in terra.
verses.english: “Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

verses.latin: Panem nostrum cotidianum da nobis hodie.
verses.english: “Give us this day our daily bread,

verses.latin: Et dimitte nobis debita nostra, sicut et nos dimittimus debitoribus nostris.
verses.english: “And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

verses.latin: Et ne nos inducas in tentationem: sed libera nos a malo. Amen.
verses.english: “And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.”

verses.latin: Si enim dimiseritis hominibus peccata eorum, dimittet et vobis Pater vester caelestis peccata vestra.
verses.english: For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you,

verses.latin: Si autem non dimiseritis hominibus, nec Pater vester dimittet vobis peccata vestra.
verses.english: but if you do not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

verses.latin: Cum autem ieiunatis, nolite fieri sicut hypocritae, tristes. Concurrunt enim faciem suam, ut appareant hominibus ieiunantes. Amen dico vobis, quia receperunt mercedem suam.
verses.english: “And when you fast, do not look gloomy like the hypocrites, for they disfigure their faces that their fasting may be seen by others. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

verses.latin: Tu autem cum ieiunas, unge caput tuum, et faciem tuam lava,
verses.english: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,

verses.latin: ne videaris hominibus ieiunans, sed Patri tuo, qui est in abscondito: et Pater tuus, qui videt in abscondito, reddet tibi.
verses.english: that your fasting may not be seen by others but by your Father, who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will repay you.

verses.latin: Nolite thesaurizare vobis thesauros in terra: ubi erugo et tinea demolitur, et ubi fures effodiunt et furantur.
verses.english: “Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal,

verses.latin: Thesaurizate autem vobis thesauros in caelo: ubi neque erugo neque tinea demolitur, et ubi fures non effodiunt nec furantur.
verses.english: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.

verses.latin: Ubi enim thesaurus tuus est, ibi et cor tuum.
verses.english: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

verses.latin: Lucerna corporis est oculus: si fuerit ergo oculus tuus simplex, totum corpus tuum lucidum erit.
verses.english: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So, if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light,

verses.latin: Si autem oculus tuus nequam fuerit, totum corpus tuum tenebrosum erit. Si ergo lux, quae in te est, tenebrae sunt: quantae tenebrae?
verses.english: but if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

verses.latin: Nemo potest duobus dominis servire: aut enim unum odio habebit, et alterum diliget, aut unum sustinebit, et alterum contemnet. Non potestis Deo servire et mammonae.
verses.english: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.

verses.latin: Ideo dico vobis, nolite solliciti esse animae vestrae quid manducetis, neque corpori vestro quid induamini. Nonne anima plus est quam esca, et corpus plus quam vestimentum?
verses.english: “Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

verses.latin: Respicit volucres caeli, quoniam non serunt neque metunt neque congregant in horrea: et Pater vester caelestis pascit illa. Nonne vos magis estis illis pretiosiores?
verses.english: Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?

verses.latin: Quis autem vestrum cogitando potest adjicere cubito suo unam cubitum?
verses.english: And which of you by being anxious can add a single hour to his span of life?

verses.latin: Et de vestimento quid solliciti estis? considerate lilia agri quomodo crescunt: non laborant, neque nent.
verses.english: And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin,

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis quia nec Salomon in omni gloria sua coopertus est sicut unum ex istis.
verses.english: yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

verses.latin: Si autem foenum agri, quod hodie est, et cras in clibanum mittitur, Deus sic vestit: quanto magis vos modicae fidei?
verses.english: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is alive and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

verses.latin: Nolite ergo solliciti esse, dicentes: Quid manducabimus, aut quid bibemus, aut quo operiemur?
verses.english: Therefore do not be anxious, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’

verses.latin: Haec enim omnia gentes inquirunt. Scit enim Pater vester, quia his omnibus indigetis.
verses.english: For the Gentiles seek after all these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them all.

verses.latin: Quaerite ergo primum regnum Dei et iustitiam ejus: et haec omnia adicientur vobis.
verses.english: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

verses.latin: Nolite ergo solliciti esse in crastinum. Crastinus enim dies sollicitus erit sibi ipsi. Sufficit diei malitia sua.
verses.english: “Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.

verses.latin: Nolite judicare, ut non judicemini.
verses.english: Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.

verses.latin: In quo enim judicio judicaveritis, judicabimini: et in qua mensura metiti fueritis, remetietur vobis.
verses.english: Because in the way you judge, you will be judged. And in the measure you use, it will be measured to you.

verses.latin: Quid autem vides festucam in oculo fratris tui, et trabem in oculo tuo non vides?
verses.english: And why do you see a splinter in your brother's eye, but the beam in your own eye do you not see?

verses.latin: Aut quomodo dicis fratris tuo: Sine ejiciam festucam de oculo tuo: et ecce trabs est in oculo tuo?
verses.english: Or how do you say to your brother, ‘Let me cast the splinter out of your eye,’ and look, there is a beam in your own eye?

verses.latin: Hypocrita, ejice primum trabem de oculo tuo, et tunc videbis ejicere festucam de oculo fratris tui.
verses.english: Hypocrite, first cast out the beam from your own eye, and then you will see how to cast the splinter out of your brother's eye.

verses.latin: Nolite dare sanctum canibus: neque mittatis margaritas vestras ante porcos, ne forte conculcent eas pedibus suis, et conversi dirumpant vos.
verses.english: Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, lest perhaps they trample them with their feet, and turning, they tear you to pieces.

verses.latin: Petite, et dabitur vobis: quaerite, et invenietis: pulsate, et aperietur vobis.
verses.english: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

verses.latin: Omnis enim qui petit, accipit: et qui quaerit, invenit: et pulsanti aperietur.
verses.english: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks, it will be opened.

verses.latin: Aut quis est ex vobis homo, quem si filius ejus petierit panem, numquid lapidem porriget illi?
verses.english: Or what man is there among you, whom if his son asks for bread, will he hand him a stone?

verses.latin: Aut si piscem petierit, numquid serpentem porriget illi?
verses.english: Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent?

verses.latin: Si ergo vos cum sitis mali, nostis bona data dare filiis vestris: quanto magis Pater vester, qui in caelis est, dabit bona petentibus se?
verses.english: If then you, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask Him?

verses.latin: Omnia ergo quaecumque vultis ut faciant vobis homines, et vos facite illis. Haec est enim lex et prophetæ.
verses.english: Therefore, all things that you want men to do to you, do also to them. For this is the Law and the Prophets.

verses.latin: Intrate per angustam portam: quia lata porta, et spatiosa via est, quae ducit ad perditionem, et multi sunt qui intrant per eam.
verses.english: Enter through the narrow gate; because wide is the gate, and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter by it.

verses.latin: Quam angusta porta, et arcta via est, quae ducit ad vitam: et pauci sunt qui inveniunt eam!
verses.english: How narrow is the gate, and constricted is the way that leads to life; and few are those who find it!

verses.latin: Attendite a falsis prophetis, qui veniunt ad vos in vestimentis ovium, intus autem sunt lupi rapaces:
verses.english: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly are ravenous wolves.

verses.latin: a fructibus eorum cognoscetis eos. Numquid colligunt de spinis uvas, aut de tribulis ficus?
verses.english: By their fruits you will know them. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

verses.latin: Sic omnis arbor bona fructus bonos facit: mala autem arbor fructus malos facit.
verses.english: So every good tree brings forth good fruits, and a bad tree brings forth bad fruits.

verses.latin: Non potest arbor bona malos fructus facere: neque arbor mala fructus bonos facere.
verses.english: A good tree cannot bring forth bad fruits, nor can a bad tree bring forth good fruits.

verses.latin: Omnis arbor, quae non facit fructum bonum, excidetur, et in ignem mittetur.
verses.english: Every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.

verses.latin: Igitur ex fructibus eorum cognoscetis eos.
verses.english: Therefore, by their fruits you will know them.

verses.latin: Non omnis qui dicit mihi, Domine, Domine, intrabit in regnum caelorum: sed qui facit voluntatem Patris mei, qui in caelis est, ipse intrabit in regnum caelorum.
verses.english: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven will enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.latin: Multi dicent mihi in illa die: Domine, Domine, nonne in nomine tuo prophetavimus, et in nomine tuo daemonia ejecimus, et in nomine tuo virtutes multas fecimus?
verses.english: Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many mighty works in your name?’

verses.latin: Et tunc confitebor illis: Quia numquam novi vos: discedite a me, qui operamini iniquitatem.
verses.english: And then I will confess to them: ‘I never knew you; depart from me, you who work iniquity.’

verses.latin: Omnis ergo qui audit verba mea haec, et facit ea, assimilabitur viro sapienti, qui ædificavit domum suam super petram.
verses.english: Therefore, everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be likened to a wise man who built his house upon a rock.

verses.latin: Et descendit pluvia, et venerunt flumina, et flaverunt venti, et irruerunt in domum illam, et non cecidit: fundata enim erat super petram.
verses.english: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it did not fall, because it was founded upon a rock.

verses.latin: Et omnis qui audit verba mea haec, et non facit ea, similis erit viro stulto, qui ædificavit domum suam super arenam:
verses.english: And everyone who hears these words of mine, and does not do them, will be like a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.

verses.latin: Et descendit pluvia, et venerunt flumina, et flaverunt venti, et irruerunt in domum illam, et cecidit: et fuit ruina illius magna.
verses.english: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell, and great was its ruin.

verses.latin: Et factum est: cum consummasset Jesus verba haec, admirabantur turbæ super doctrinam ejus.
verses.english: And it happened that when Jesus had finished these words, the crowds were astonished at his teaching.

verses.latin: Erat enim docens eos sicut potestatem habens, et non sicut scribæ eorum.
verses.english: For he taught them as one having authority, and not as their scribes.

verses.latin: Cum autem descendisset de monte, secutae sunt eum turbae multae.
verses.english: When Jesus came down from the mountain, great crowds followed Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce, leprosus veniens adorabat eum, dicens: Domine, si vis, potes me mundare.
verses.english: And behold, a leper came and worshipped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”

verses.latin: Et extendens manum, tetigit eum, dicens: Volo: munda.
verses.english: And stretching out His hand, He touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.”

verses.latin: Et confestim mundata est lepra ejus. Et ait illi Jesus: Vide, nemini dixeris: sed vade, ostende te sacerdoti, et offer donum, quod praecepit Moyses, in testimonium illis.
verses.english: And immediately his leprosy was cleansed. And Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

verses.latin: Cum autem venisset Capharnaum, accessit ad eum centurio, rogans eum,
verses.english: When He had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, beseeching Him,

verses.latin: et dicens: Domine, puer meus iacet in domo paralyticus, et male torquetur.
verses.english: and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, dreadfully tormented.”

verses.latin: Et ait illi Jesus: Ego veniam, et curabo eum.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”

verses.latin: Et respondens centurio, ait: Domine, non sum dignus ut intres sub tectum meum: sed tantum dic verbo, et sanabitur puer meus.
verses.english: The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof; but only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.

verses.latin: Nam et ego homo sum sub potestate, habens sub me milites: et dico huic: Vade, et vadit: et alio: Veni, et venit: et servo meo: Fac hoc, et facit.
verses.english: For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

verses.latin: Audiens autem Jesus, miratus est, et dixit sequentibus se: Amen dico vobis, non inveni tantam fidem in Israel.
verses.english: When Jesus heard this, He marveled and said to those who followed Him, “Truly, I say to you, I have not found such great faith in anyone in Israel.

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis, quod multi a solis ortu et occasu venient, et recumbent cum Abraham, et Isaac, et Jacob in regno caelorum:
verses.english: I say to you that many will come from the east and west and recline at table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,

verses.latin: filii autem regni eicientur in tenebras exteriores: ibi erit fletus, et stridor dentium.
verses.english: but the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into the outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Jesus centurioni: Vade, et sicut credidisti, fiat tibi. Et sanatus est puer in hora illa.
verses.english: And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; let it be done for you as you have believed.” And the servant was healed that very hour.

verses.latin: Et cum venisset Jesus in domum Petri, vidit uxorem Petri jacentem, et febricitantem.
verses.english: When Jesus had entered Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.

verses.latin: Et tetigit manum ejus, et dimisit eam febris: et surrexit, et ministrabat eis.
verses.english: He touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she arose and served Him.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto, obtulerunt ei multos daemonium habentes: et eiecit spiritus verbo, et omnes male habentes curavit:
verses.english: When evening came, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed; and He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.

verses.latin: ut impleretur quod dictum est per Isaiam prophetam dicentem: Ipse infirmitates nostras accepit, et aegrotationes portavit.
verses.english: This was to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah: “He Himself took our infirmities and bore our sicknesses.”

verses.latin: Videns autem Jesus turbas multas circa se, jussit ire trans fretum.
verses.english: Now when Jesus saw great crowds around Him, He gave orders to go over to the other side.

verses.latin: Et accedens unus scriba, ait illi: Magister, sequar te quocumque ieris.
verses.english: And a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”

verses.latin: Et dicit ei Jesus: Vulpes foveas habent, et volucres caeli nidos: Filius autem hominis non habet ubi caput reclinet.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”

verses.latin: Alius autem de discipulis ejus dixit ei: Domine, permitte mihi primum ire, et sepelire patrem meum.
verses.english: And another of the disciples said to Him, “Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem dicit ei: Séquere me, et dimitte mortuos sepelire mortuos suos.
verses.english: But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”

verses.latin: Et ascendente eo in navim, secuti sunt eum discipuli ejus.
verses.english: And when He got into the boat, His disciples followed Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce, tempestas magna facta est in mari, ita ut navis operiretur fluctibus: ipse vero dormiebat.
verses.english: And behold, a great storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was being covered with waves, but He was sleeping.

verses.latin: Et accesserunt ad eum discipuli ejus, et suscitaverunt eum, dicentes: Domine, salva nos, perimus.
verses.english: And they came to Him and woke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”

verses.latin: Et dicit eis Jesus: Quid timidi estis, modicae fidei? Tunc surgens imperavit ventis et mari: et facta est tranquillitas magna.
verses.english: And He said to them, “Why are you afraid, you of little faith?” Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

verses.latin: Porro homines mirati sunt, dicentes: Qualis est hic, quia venti et mare obediunt ei?
verses.english: And the men marveled, saying, “What kind of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”

verses.latin: Et cum venisset trans fretum in regionem Gerasenorum, occurrerunt ei duo habentes daemonia, de monumento exientes, saevissimi, ita ut nemo posset transire per viam illam.
verses.english: And when He had come to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men met Him as they came out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass that way.

verses.latin: Et ecce, clamaverunt, dicentes: Quid nobis et tibi, Jesu, Fili Dei? Venisti huc ante tempus torquere nos?
verses.english: And they cried out, saying, “What do we have to do with You, Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”

verses.latin: Erat autem non longe ab illis grex porcorum multorum pascentium.
verses.english: Now some distance from them there was a herd of many swine feeding.

verses.latin: Daemones autem rogabant eum, dicentes: Si eicis nos, mitte nos in gregem porcorum.
verses.english: And the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, send us away into the herd of swine.”

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Ite. Et euntes in porcos, tota grex porcorum praecipitatus est de praecipitio in mare: et mortui sunt in aquis.
verses.english: And He said to them, “Go!” And when they came out, they went into the swine, and behold, the whole herd of swine rushed down the steep bank into the sea and died in the waters.

verses.latin: Pastores autem fugerunt: et abierunt in civitatem, et nuntiaverunt omnia, et de his qui daemonia habuerant.
verses.english: Then the herdsmen fled, and they went away to the city and told everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.

verses.latin: Et ecce, tota civitas exiit obviam Jesu: et videntes eum, rogaverunt ut transiret de finibus eorum.
verses.english: And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus; and when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart from their region.

verses.latin: Et ascendens in navim, transfretavit, et venit in civitatem suam.
verses.english: Then, Jesus got into a boat and crossed the sea to return to his own city.

verses.latin: Et ecce, offerentes ei paralyticum in lecto jacentem.
verses.english: And as he arrived, some people brought to him a paralytic, who was lying on a bed.

verses.latin: Et videns Jesus fidem illorum, dixit paralytico: Confide, fili, remittuntur tibi peccata tua.
verses.english: Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralytic, “Have courage, my son; your sins are forgiven.”

verses.latin: Et ecce, quidam de scribis dixerunt intra se: Hic blasphemat.
verses.english: Some of the scribes, however, thought to themselves, “This man is blaspheming.”

verses.latin: Et sciens Jesus cogitationes eorum, dixit: Ut quid cogitatis mala in cordibus vestris?
verses.english: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you consider evil things in your hearts?

verses.latin: Quid est facilius dicere: Dimittuntur tibi peccata tua: an dicere: Surge, et ambula?
verses.english: Is it easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Rise and walk’?

verses.latin: Ut autem sciatis, quia Filius hominis potestatem habet in terra dimittendi peccata: tunc dicit paralytico: Surge, tolle lectum tuum, et vade in domum tuam.
verses.english: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”—then Jesus said to the paralytic, “Rise, take your bed, and go home.”

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et abiit in domum suam.
verses.english: And immediately he rose and went home.

verses.latin: Videntes autem turbae, timuerunt, et glorificaverunt Deum, qui dedit potestatem talem hominibus.
verses.english: Seeing this, the crowds were struck with fear and glorified God, who had given such power to men.

verses.latin: Et cum transiret inde Jesus, vidit hominem sedentem in telonio, Matthaeum nomine, et ait illi: Sequere me. Et surrexit, et secutus est eum.
verses.english: As Jesus passed on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. Jesus said to him, “Follow me.” And Matthew rose and followed him.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum accumberet in domo, ecce multi publicani et peccatores venientes, accubuerunt cum Jesu et discipulis ejus.
verses.english: While Jesus was at dinner in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and ate with him and his disciples.

verses.latin: Et videntes Pharisaei, dicebant discipulis ejus: Quare cum publicanis et peccatoribus manducat Magister vester?
verses.english: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

verses.latin: At Jesus audiens, dixit: Non necesse habent sani medicum, sed qui male se habent.
verses.english: But when Jesus heard this, he said, “Those who are healthy don’t need a doctor, but those who are sick.

verses.latin: Euntes autem, discite quid est: Misericordiam volo, et non sacrificium. Non enim veni vocare justos, sed peccatores.
verses.english: But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.’ For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

verses.latin: Tunc accesserunt ad eum discipuli Joannis, dicentes: Quare nos et Pharisaei jejunamus frequenter, discipuli autem tui non jejunant?
verses.english: Then John's disciples came to him, asking, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”

verses.latin: Et ait illis Jesus: Numquid possunt filii sponsi lugere, quamdiu cum illis est sponsus? Venient autem dies quando auferetur ab eis sponsus: et tunc jejunabunt.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests mourn while the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom is taken away, and then they will fast.

verses.latin: Nemo autem immittit commissuram panni rudis in vestimentum vetus: tollit enim plenitudinem suam a vestimento, et pejor scissura fit.
verses.english: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch pulls away from the garment, and the tear becomes worse.

verses.latin: Neque mittunt vinum novum in utres veteres: alioquin rumpuntur utres, et vinum effunditur, et utres pereunt. Sed novum vinum in utres novos mittunt: et simul conservantur.
verses.english: Nor do people put new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the wineskins burst, the wine spills out, and the wineskins are destroyed. But they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and so both are preserved.”

verses.latin: Haec illo loquente ad eos, ecce princeps quidam veniens, adorabat eum, dicens: Domine, filia mea modo defuncta est: sed veni, impone manum tuam super eam, et vivet.
verses.english: While he was saying these things to them, a certain ruler came and knelt before him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come, put your hand on her, and she will live.”

verses.latin: Et surgens Jesus, sequebatur eum, et discipuli ejus.
verses.english: Jesus rose and followed him, with his disciples.

verses.latin: Et ecce, mulier, quae sanguinis fluxum patiebatur duodecim annis, accessit retro, et tetigit fimbriam vestimenti ejus.
verses.english: Suddenly, a woman who had suffered from a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his garment.

verses.latin: Dicebat enim intra se: Si tetigero tantum vestimentum ejus, salva ero.
verses.english: For she said to herself, “If I only touch his garment, I shall be made well.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem conversus, et videns eam, dixit: Confide, filia, fides tua te salvam fecit. Et salva facta est mulier ex illa hora.
verses.english: Jesus turned, and seeing her, said, “Have courage, daughter; your faith has saved you.” And from that moment, the woman was made well.

verses.latin: Et cum venisset Jesus in domum principis, et vidit tibicines et turbam flentes,
verses.english: When Jesus arrived at the ruler’s house, he saw the flute players and the crowd making a commotion.

verses.latin: dixit: Recedite: non est enim mortua puella, sed dormit. Et irridebant eum.
verses.english: He said, “Get out! The girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” And they laughed at him.

verses.latin: Et cum ejecta esset turba, intravit, et apprehendit manum ejus, et surrexit puella.
verses.english: But when the crowd was put out, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

verses.latin: Et exiit fama haec in universam terram illam.
verses.english: And the news of this spread throughout that whole region.

verses.latin: Et transeunte inde Jesu, secuti sunt eum duo caeci, clamantes, et dicentes: Miserere nostri, Fili David.
verses.english: As Jesus passed on from there, two blind men followed him, crying out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

verses.latin: Et cum venisset in domum, accesserunt ad eum caeci. Et dicit eis Jesus: Creditis quia hoc possum facere?
verses.english: When he entered the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I can do this?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Utique, Domine. Tunc tetigit oculos eorum, dicens: Secundum fidem vestram, fiat vobis.
verses.english: They said to him, “Yes, Lord.” Then he touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith, let it be done for you.”

verses.latin: Et aperti sunt oculi eorum. Et comminatus est illis Jesus, dicens: Videte, ne sciatis.
verses.english: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one knows about this.”

verses.latin: Illi autem egredientes, diffamaverunt eum in tota terra illa.
verses.english: But they went out and spread the news of him throughout that whole region.

verses.latin: Egredientibus autem illis, ecce obtulerunt ei mutum hominem daemonium habentem.
verses.english: After they went out, behold, they brought to him a mute man possessed by a demon.

verses.latin: Et ejecto daemone, locutus est mutus: et miratae sunt turbae, dicentes: Numquam apparuit sic in Israel.
verses.english: And when the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. And the crowds marveled, saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”

verses.latin: Pharisaei autem dicebant: In principe daemoniorum ejicit daemones.
verses.english: But the Pharisees said, “By the prince of demons he casts out demons.”

verses.latin: Et circuibat Jesus omnes civitates et castella, docens in synagogis eorum, et praedicans Evangelium regni, et curans omnem languorem, et omnem infirmitatem.
verses.english: Jesus traveled throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every infirmity.

verses.latin: Videns autem turbas, misertus est eis: quia erant vexati, et jacentes sicut oves non habentes pastorem.
verses.english: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

verses.latin: Tunc dicit discipulis suis: Messis quidem multa, operarii autem pauci.
verses.english: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

verses.latin: Rogate ergo Dominum messis, ut mittat operarios in messem suam.
verses.english: Therefore, pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.”

verses.latin: Et convocatis duodecim discipulis suis, dedit illis potestatem spirituum immundorum, ut ejicerent eos, et curarent omnem languorem, et omnem infirmitatem.
verses.english: And when He had called His twelve disciples, He gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to cure every sickness and every disease.

verses.latin: Duodecim autem Apostolorum nomina sunt haec: Primus, Simon, qui dicitur Petrus, et Andreas frater ejus, et Jacobus Zebedaei, et Joannes frater ejus,
verses.english: And these are the names of the twelve Apostles: the first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother,

verses.latin: Philippus, et Bartholomaeus, Thomas, et Matthaeus publicanus, et Jacobus Alphaei, et Thaddaeus,
verses.english: Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas, and Matthew the tax collector, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus,

verses.latin: Simon Chananaeus, et Judas Iscariotes, qui et tradidit eum.
verses.english: Simon the Cananean, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.

verses.latin: Hos duodecim misit Jesus, praecipiens eis, dicens: In viam gentium ne abieritis, et in civitatem Samaritanorum ne intraveritis:
verses.english: These twelve Jesus sent, commanding them, saying: “Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter into any city of the Samaritans.

verses.latin: sed potius ite ad oves, quae perierunt domus Israel.
verses.english: But go instead to the sheep that have gone astray from the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Euntes autem, praedicate, dicentes: Quia appropinquavit regnum caelorum.
verses.english: And as you go, preach, saying: ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’

verses.latin: Infirmos curate, mortuos suscitate, leprosos munda, daemones ejicite: gratis accepistis, gratis date.
verses.english: Cure the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers, cast out demons: you have received freely, give freely.

verses.latin: Nolite possidere aurum, neque argentum, neque pecuniam in zonis vestris:
verses.english: Do not acquire gold, nor silver, nor money in your purses:

verses.latin: non peram in via, neque duas tunicas, neque calceamenta, neque virgam: dignus est enim operarius cibo suo.
verses.english: Nor a bag for the journey, nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor a staff: for the workman is worthy of his food.

verses.latin: In quamcumque autem civitatem aut vicum intraveritis, interrogate, quis in ea dignus sit: et ibi manete donec exeatis.
verses.english: And into whatever city or village you enter, inquire who in it is worthy: and stay there until you leave.

verses.latin: Intrantes autem domum, salutate eam, dicentes: Pax huic domui.
verses.english: And entering into the house, greet it, saying: ‘Peace to this house.’

verses.latin: Et si quidem fuerit domus digna, veniet pax vestra super illam: si autem non fuerit digna, pax vestra revertetur ad vos.
verses.english: And if the house is worthy, your peace will come upon it: but if it is not worthy, your peace will return to you.

verses.latin: Et quicumque non receperit vos, neque audierit sermones vestros: exeuntes foras de domo, vel civitate, excutite pulverem de pedibus vestris.
verses.english: And whoever does not receive you, nor hear your words: leaving that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, tolerabilius erit terrae Sodomorum et Gomorraeorum in die judicii, quam illi civitati.
verses.english: Amen I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.

verses.latin: Ecce ego mitto vos sicut oves in medio luporum. Estote ergo prudentes sicut serpentes, et simplices sicut columbae.
verses.english: Behold, I send you as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be prudent as serpents, and simple as doves.

verses.latin: Attendite autem a hominibus. Tradent enim vos in conciliis, et in synagogis suis flagellabunt vos:
verses.english: But beware of men. For they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you:

verses.latin: et ad praesides, et ad reges ducedimini propter me, in testimonium illis et gentibus.
verses.english: And you will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, for a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Cum autem tradiderint vos, nolite solliciti esse quomodo aut quid loquamini: dabitur enim vobis in illa hora quid loquamini:
verses.english: But when they deliver you up, do not be anxious about how or what you are to speak: for it will be given to you in that hour what you are to say:

verses.latin: non enim vos estis qui loquimini, sed Spiritus Patris vestri, qui loquitur in vobis.
verses.english: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.

verses.latin: Tradet autem frater fratrem in mortem, et pater filium: et insurgent filii in parentes, et morte eos afficient:
verses.english: And the brother will deliver up the brother to death, and the father the son: and children will rise up against their parents, and cause them to be put to death:

verses.latin: et eritis odio omnibus propter nomen meum: qui autem perseveraverit usque in finem, hic salvus erit.
verses.english: And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake: but he who perseveres until the end, he will be saved.

verses.latin: Cum autem persequentur vos in civitate ista, fugite in aliam. Amen dico vobis, non consummabitis civitates Israel, donec veniat Filius hominis.
verses.english: And when they persecute you in this city, flee to another. Amen I say to you, you will not finish the cities of Israel until the Son of Man comes.

verses.latin: Non est discipulus super magistrum, nec servus super dominum suum:
verses.english: The disciple is not above his master, nor is the servant above his lord.

verses.latin: sufficit discipulo ut sit sicut magister ejus, et servo ut sit sicut dominus ejus. Si dominum domus Beelzebub vocaverunt, quanto magis domesticos ejus?
verses.english: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more those of his household?

verses.latin: Nolite ergo timere eos. Nihil enim est opertum, quod non revelabitur: et occultum, quod non scietur.
verses.english: Therefore do not fear them. For there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed: and nothing secret that will not be known.

verses.latin: Quod dico vobis in tenebris, dicite in lumine: et quod in aure auditis, praedicate super tecta.
verses.english: What I say to you in the dark, speak in the light: and what you hear in the ear, preach on the housetops.

verses.latin: Et nolite timere eos, qui occidunt corpus, animam autem non possunt occidere: sed potius timete eum, qui potest et animam et corpus perdere in gehennam.
verses.english: And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul: but rather fear Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

verses.latin: Nonne duo passeres asse veneunt? et unus ex illis non cadet super terram sine Patre vestro.
verses.english: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? And not one of them will fall on the ground without your Father.

verses.latin: Vestri autem capilli capitis omnes numerati sunt.
verses.english: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

verses.latin: Nolite ergo timere: multis passeribus meliores estis vos.
verses.english: Therefore do not be afraid: you are more valuable than many sparrows.

verses.latin: Omnis ergo qui confitebitur me coram hominibus, confitebor et ego eum coram Patre meo, qui in caelis est.
verses.english: Therefore everyone who acknowledges Me before men, I will also acknowledge him before My Father who is in heaven.

verses.latin: Qui autem negaverit me coram hominibus, negabo et ego eum coram Patre meo, qui in caelis est.
verses.english: But whoever denies Me before men, I will also deny him before My Father who is in heaven.

verses.latin: Nolite putare quia pacem miserim in terram: non veni pacem mittere, sed gladium.
verses.english: Do not think that I came to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.

verses.latin: Veni enim separare hominem adversus patrem suum, et filiam adversus matrem suam, et nurum adversus socrum suam:
verses.english: For I came to set a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law:

verses.latin: et inimici hominis, domestici ejus.
verses.english: And a man’s enemies will be those of his own household.

verses.latin: Qui amat patrem aut matrem plus quam me, non est me dignus: et qui amat filium aut filiam super me, non est me dignus.
verses.english: He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me: and he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.

verses.latin: Et qui non accipit crucem suam, et sequitur me, non est me dignus.
verses.english: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow Me is not worthy of Me.

verses.latin: Qui invenit animam suam, perdet eam: et qui perdit animam suam propter me, inveniet eam.
verses.english: He who finds his life will lose it: and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.

verses.latin: Qui vos recipit, me recipit: et qui me recipit, recipit eum qui me misit.
verses.english: He who receives you receives Me: and he who receives Me receives Him Who sent Me.

verses.latin: Qui recipit prophetam in nomine prophetae, mercedem prophetae accipiet: et qui recipit justum in nomine justi, mercedem justi accipiet.
verses.english: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward: and he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.

verses.latin: Et quicumque potum dederit uni ex minimis istis calicem aquae frigidae tantum in nomine discipuli: amen dico vobis, non perdet mercedem suam.
verses.english: And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple: Amen I say to you, he will not lose his reward.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum consummasset Iesus praecipiens duodecim discipulis suis,transiit inde docere, et praedicare in civitatibus eorum.
verses.english: After Jesus had finished giving instructions to His twelve disciples, He went on from there to teach and preach in their towns.

verses.latin: Ioannes autem cum audisset in vinculis opera Christi, mittens duos de discipulis suis,
verses.english: When John heard in prison about the things that Christ was doing, he sent two of his disciples,

verses.latin: ait illi: Tu es qui venturus es, an alium exspectamus?
verses.english: asking Him, "Are You the One who is to come, or should we look for another?"

verses.latin: Et respondens Iesus,ait illis: Euntes renuntiate Ioanni quae audistis et vidistis:
verses.english: Jesus replied, "Go back and report to John what you hear and see:

verses.latin: caeci vident, claudi ambulant, leprosi mundantur, surdi audiunt, mortui resurgunt, pauperes evangelizantur.
verses.english: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those with leprosy are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor are evangelized."

verses.latin: Et beatus est, qui non fuerit scandalizatus in me.
verses.english: Blessed is the one who is not offended by Me."

verses.latin: Illis autem abeuntibus, coepit Iesus dicere ad turbas de Ioanne: Quid existis in desertum videre? Arundinem vento agitatam?
verses.english: As John’s disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: "What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

verses.latin: sed quid existis videre? Hominem mollibus vestitum? Ecce, qui mollibus vestiuntur, in domibus regum sunt.
verses.english: Or what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Those who wear fine clothes are in royal palaces.

verses.latin: Sed quid existis videre? Prophetam? Etiam dico vobis, et plus quam prophetam.
verses.english: Or what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

verses.latin: Hic est enim de quo scriptum est: Ecce ego mitto angelum meum ante faciem tuam, qui praeparabit viam tuam ante te.
verses.english: This is the one about whom it is written: ‘I will send My messenger ahead of You, who will prepare Your way before You.’
