verses.latin: At ille respondens uni eorum, dixit: Amice, non facio tibi injuriam: nonne ex denario convenisti mecum?
verses.english: But he replied to one of them, 'Friend, I do you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?

verses.latin: Tolle quod tuum est, et vade: volo autem et huic novissimo dare sicut et tibi.
verses.english: Take what belongs to you and go. I want to give to this last one the same as I gave to you.

verses.latin: Aut non licet mihi quod volo, facere? an oculus tuus nequam est, quia ego bonus sum?
verses.english: Am I not allowed to do what I want with my own things? Or are you envious because I am generous?'

verses.latin: Sic erunt novissimi primi, et primi novissimi. Multi enim sunt vocati, pauci vero electi.
verses.english: In this way the last will be first, and the first will be last. Many are called, but few are chosen.

verses.latin: Et ascendens Jesus Jerosolymam, assumpsit duodecim discipulos secreto, et ait illis:
verses.english: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside in private and said to them,

verses.latin: Ecce, ascendimus Jerosolymam, et Filius hominis tradetur principibus sacerdotum et scribis, et damnabunt eum morte,
verses.english: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death,

verses.latin: et tradent eum gentibus ad illudendum, et flagellandum, et crucifigendum, et tertia die resurget.
verses.english: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified, and on the third day he will be raised.”

verses.latin: Tunc accessit ad eum mater filiorum Zebedaei cum filiis suis, adorans et petens aliquid ab eo.
verses.english: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to Jesus with her sons. She knelt down and asked him for a favor.

verses.latin: Qui dixit ei: Quid vis? Ait illi: Dic ut sedeant hi filii mei, unus ad dexteram tuam, et alius ad sinistram in regno tuo.
verses.english: He said to her, “What do you want?” She replied, “Grant that these two sons of mine may sit, one at your right hand and the other at your left, in your kingdom.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jesus, dixit: Nescitis quid petatis. Potestis bibere calicem, quem ego bibiturus sum?
verses.english: But Jesus answered, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am going to drink?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Possumus. Ait illis: Calicem quidem meum bibetis: sed sedere ad dexteram meam, vel sinistram, non est meum dare vobis, sed quibus paratum est a Patre meo.
verses.english: They said to him, “We are able.” Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink my cup, but to sit at my right and left is not mine to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”

verses.latin: Et audientes decem, concepti sunt de duobus fratribus, et irati sunt.
verses.english: When the other ten disciples heard about this, they became indignant with the two brothers.

verses.latin: Jesus autem convocavit eos ad se, et dixit: Scitis quia principes gentium dominantur eorum: et qui magni sunt, potestatem exercent in eos.
verses.english: But Jesus called them to him and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

verses.latin: Non ita erit inter vos: sed quicumque voluerit inter vos magnus fieri, sit vester minister:
verses.english: It shall not be this way among you; but whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

verses.latin: et quicumque voluerit inter vos primus esse, erit vester servus:
verses.english: and whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave,

verses.latin: sicut Filius hominis non venit ministrari, sed ministrare, et dare animam suam redemptionem pro multis.
verses.english: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

verses.latin: Et egredientibus illis de Jericho, secuta est eum turba multa.
verses.english: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

verses.latin: Et ecce duo caeci sedentes secus viam, audierunt quod Jesus transiret: et clamaverunt, dicentes: Domine, fili David, miserere nostri.
verses.english: And two blind men sitting beside the road heard that Jesus was passing by. They cried out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

verses.latin: Turba autem increpabat eos ut tacerent. Illi autem magis clamabant, dicentes: Domine, miserere nostri, fili David.
verses.english: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

verses.latin: Et stetit Jesus, et vocavit eos, et dixit: Quid vultis faciam vobis?
verses.english: Jesus stopped and called them. He asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Domine, ut aperiantur oculi nostri.
verses.english: They said to him, “Lord, we want our eyes to be opened.”

verses.latin: Misertus eorum Jesus, tetigit oculos eorum: et statim viderunt, et secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: Jesus, moved with compassion, touched their eyes, and immediately they received their sight and followed him.

verses.latin: Et cum appropinquassent Ierosolymis, et venissent Bethphage ad montem Oliveti, tunc misit Iesus duos discipulos,
verses.english: When they drew near to Jerusalem and arrived at Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,

verses.latin: dicens eis: Ite in castellum, quod contra vos est: et statim invenietis asinam alligatam, et pullum cum ea: solvite, et adducite mihi.
verses.english: saying to them, “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her; untie them and bring them to me.”

verses.latin: Et si quis vobis aliquid dixerit, dicite quia Dominus his opus habet: et confestim dimittet eos.
verses.english: If anyone says anything to you, tell them that the Lord has need of them, and immediately he will let them go.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem totum factum est, ut adimpleretur quod dictum est per prophetam dicentem:
verses.english: All this happened so that what was spoken by the prophet would be fulfilled, saying,

verses.latin: Dicite filiæ Sion: Ecce Rex tuus venit tibi mansuetus, sedens super asinam, et pullum filium subjacentis.
verses.english: “Tell the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your King comes to you, meek, and sitting on a donkey, and a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”

verses.latin: Euntes autem discipuli fecerunt sicut præceperat illis Iesus.
verses.english: So the disciples went and did as Jesus had directed them.

verses.latin: Et adduxerunt asinam et pullum: et posuerunt super eos vestimenta sua, et sedit super eos.
verses.english: They brought the donkey and the colt, and put their garments on them, and He sat on them.

verses.latin: Maxima autem pars turbæ straverunt vestimenta sua in via: alii autem cædebant ramos de arboribus, et spargebant in via:
verses.english: Most of the crowd spread their garments on the road, and others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

verses.latin: turbæ autem, quæ præcedebant, et quæ sequebantur, clamabant, dicentes: Hosanna Filio David: benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini: Hosanna in altissimis.
verses.english: The crowds, who went before Him and who followed Him, cried out, saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

verses.latin: Et cum introyisset in Jerosolymam, commota est universa civitas, dicens: Quis est hic?
verses.english: And when He entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”

verses.latin: Populus autem dicebat: Hic est propheta Jesus a Nazareth Galilææ.
verses.english: The crowds said, “This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth of Galilee.”

verses.latin: Et intravit Jesus in templum Dei, et ejiciebat vendentes et ementes in templo, et mensas nummulariorum, et cathedras vendentium columbas, evertit:
verses.english: And Jesus entered the temple of God and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple, and He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves.

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Scriptum est: Domus mea domus orationis vocabitur: vos autem fecistis illam speluncam latronum.
verses.english: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers.”

verses.latin: Et accesserunt ad eum cæci et claudi in templo: et curavit eos.
verses.english: And the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.

verses.latin: Videntes autem principes sacerdotum et scribæ mirabilia quæ fecit, et pueros clamantes in templo, et dicentes: Hosanna Filio David: indignati sunt,
verses.english: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonders that He did, and the children crying out in the temple, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were indignant.

verses.latin: et dixerunt ei: Audis quid isti dicunt? Iesus dicit eis: Utique. Numquam legistis: Quia ex ore infantium et lactantium perfecisti laudem?
verses.english: And they said to Him, “Do You hear what these are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes; have you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies You have prepared praise’?”

verses.latin: Et relictis illis, abiit foras extra civitatem in Bethaniam: et ibi mansit.
verses.english: And leaving them, He went out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.

verses.latin: Mane autem redeuns in civitatem, esuriit.
verses.english: Now in the morning, as He was returning to the city, He became hungry.

verses.latin: Et videns ficum unam secus viam, venit ad eam, et nihil invenit in ea, nisi folia tantum: et ait illi: Nunquam ex te fructus nascatur in æternum. Et confestim aruit ficulnea.
verses.english: Seeing a fig tree by the road, He went to it and found nothing on it except leaves, and He said to it, “May no fruit ever come from you again.” And immediately the fig tree withered.

verses.latin: Et videntes discipuli, mirati sunt, dicentes: Quomodo continuo aruit ficulnea?
verses.english: Seeing this, the disciples were amazed, and said, “How did the fig tree wither at once?”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Iesus, dixit eis: Amen dico vobis, si habueritis fidem, et non hæsitaveritis, non solum de ficulnea facietis, sed et si monti huic dixeritis: Tolle te, et mitte te in mare, fiet.
verses.english: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it will happen.

verses.latin: Et omnia quæcumque postulantes in oratione credideritis, accipietis.
verses.english: And all things you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”

verses.latin: Et cum venisset in templum, accesserunt ad eum docentem principes sacerdotum et seniores populi, dicentes: In qua potestate hæc facis? et quis tibi dedit hanc potestatem?
verses.english: And when He came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to Him while He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this authority?”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Iesus, dixit eis: Interrogabo vos et ego unum sermonem: quem si dixeritis mihi, et ego vobis dicam in qua potestate hæc facio.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them, “I will also ask you one thing, which if you tell Me, I will also tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.latin: Baptisma Ioannis unde erat? de cælo, an ex hominibus? At illi cogitabant inter se, dicentes:
verses.english: The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men?” They reasoned with themselves, saying,

verses.latin: Si dixerimus: De cælo, dicet nobis: Quare ergo non credidistis ei? Si autem dixerimus: Ex hominibus, timemus turbam: omnes enim habent Ioannem sicut prophetam.
verses.english: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’ But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the crowd, for they all regard John as a prophet.”

verses.latin: Et respondentes Iesu, dixerunt: Nescimus. Ait illis et ipse: Nec ego dico vobis in qua potestate hæc facio.
verses.english: So they answered Jesus and said, “We do not know.” He also said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

verses.latin: Quid autem vobis videtur? Homo habebat duos filios: et accedens ad primum, dixit: Fili, vade hodie, operare in vinea mea.
verses.english: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’

verses.latin: Qui respondens, dixit: Nolo. Postea autem pœnitentia motus, abiit.
verses.english: “And he answered and said, ‘I will not’; but afterward he regretted it and went.

verses.latin: Accedens autem ad alterum, dixit similiter. At ille respondens, dixit: Eo, Domine: et non ivit.
verses.english: “The man came to the second and said the same thing. And he answered and said, ‘I will, sir’; but he did not go.

verses.latin: Quis horum duorum fecit voluntatem patris? Dicunt ei: Primus. Dicit illis Iesus: Amen dico vobis, quia publicani et meretrices præcedent vos in regno Dei.
verses.english: “Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and prostitutes will get into the kingdom of God before you.

verses.latin: Venit enim ad vos Ioannes in via justitiæ, et non credidistis ei: publicani autem et meretrices crediderunt ei: vos autem videntes nec pœnitentiam habuistis, ut crederetis ei.
verses.english: “For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe him; and you, seeing this, did not even feel remorse afterward so as to believe him.

verses.latin: Aliam parabolam audite. Homo erat pater familias, qui plantavit vineam: et sepem circumdedit ei, et fodit in ea torcular, et ædificavit turrim: et locavit eam agricolis, et peregre profectus est.
verses.english: “Hear another parable. There was a landowner who planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a wine press in it, and built a tower, and rented it out to vine-growers and went on a journey.

verses.latin: Cum autem tempus fructuum appropinquasset, misit servos suos ad agricolas, ut acciperet fructus ejus.
verses.english: “When the harvest time approached, he sent his slaves to the vine-growers to receive his fruits.

verses.latin: Et agricolæ, prehensis servis ejus, alium ceciderunt, alium occiderunt, alium vero lapidaverunt.
verses.english: “The vine-growers took his slaves and beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

verses.latin: Iterum misit alios servos plures prioribus: et fecerunt eis similiter.
verses.english: “Again he sent other slaves, more than the first; and they did the same to them.

verses.latin: Novissime autem misit ad eos filium suum, dicens: Verebuntur filium meum.
verses.english: “Finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

verses.latin: Agricolæ autem videntes filium, dixerunt intra se: Hic est hæres: venite, occidamus eum, et possideamus hæreditatem ejus.
verses.english: “But when the vine-growers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him and seize his inheritance.’

verses.latin: Et prehensum eum, ejecerunt extra vineam, et occiderunt.
verses.english: “And they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

verses.latin: Cum ergo venerit dominus vineæ, quid faciet agricolis illis?
verses.english: “Therefore when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vine-growers?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Malos male perdet: et vineam locabit aliis agricolis, qui reddant ei fructum temporibus suis.
verses.english: They said to Him, “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end, and will rent out the vineyard to other vine-growers who will pay him the fruits in their seasons.”

verses.latin: Dicit illis Iesus: Nunquid numquam legistis in scripturis: Lapis quem reprobaverunt ædificantes, hic factus est in caput anguli: a Domino factum est istud, et est mirabile in oculis nostris?
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, This became the chief corner stone; This came about from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

verses.latin: Ideo dico vobis, quia auferetur a vobis regnum Dei, et dabitur genti facienti fructus ejus.
verses.english: “Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation producing the fruit of it.

verses.latin: Et qui ceciderit super lapidem istum, confringetur: super quem autem ceciderit, conteret eum.
verses.english: “And the one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; but on whomever it falls, it will crush him.”

verses.latin: Et cum audissent principes sacerdotum et pharisæi parabolas ejus, cognoverunt quod de ipsis diceret.
verses.english: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard His parables, they understood that He was speaking about them.

verses.latin: Et quærentes eum tenere, timuerunt turbas: quoniam sicut prophetam eum habebant.
verses.english: And although they sought to arrest Him, they feared the crowds, because they regarded Him as a prophet.

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, iterum dixit in parabolis eis dicens:
verses.english: Jesus again spoke to them in parables, saying:

verses.latin: Simile factum est regnum caelorum homini regi, qui fecit nuptias filio suo.
verses.english: “The kingdom of the universe is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.

verses.latin: Et misit servos suos vocare invitatos ad nuptias: et noluerunt venire.
verses.english: He sent his servants to summon those who were invited, but they refused to come.

verses.latin: Iterum misit alios servos, dicens: Dicite invitatis: Ecce prandium meum paravi: tauri mei, et altilia, occisa sunt, et omnia parata: venite ad nuptias.
verses.english: Then he sent more servants, saying, ‘Tell those who were invited that I have prepared my dinner. My oxen and fattened cattle have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet!’

verses.latin: Illi autem neglexerunt: et abierunt, alius in villam suam, alius vero ad negotiationem suam:
verses.english: But they paid no attention and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his business.

verses.latin: reliqui autem, tenuerunt servos ejus, et contumeliis affectos occiderunt.
verses.english: The rest seized his servants, mistreated them, and killed them.

verses.latin: Iratus est autem rex: et missis exercitibus suis, perdidit homicidas illos, et civitates eorum succendit.
verses.english: The king was enraged and sent his troops to destroy those murderers and burn their cities.

verses.latin: Tunc dicit servis suis: Nuptiæ quidem paratæ sunt: sed qui invitati sunt, non fuerunt digni:
verses.english: Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.

verses.latin: ite ergo ad exitus viarum, et quoscumque inveneritis, vocate ad nuptias.
verses.english: Go therefore to the main roads and invite to the banquet whomever you find.’

verses.latin: Et egressi servi ejus in vias, collegerunt omnes quos invenerunt, malos et bonos: et impletæ sunt nuptiæ discumbentium.
verses.english: So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all they could find, both good and bad, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.

verses.latin: Ingressus autem rex ut videret discumbentes, vidit ibi hominem non vestitum veste nuptiali.
verses.english: But when the king came in to look at the guests, he saw a man there who was not dressed in a wedding garment.

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Amice, quomodo huc intrasti, non habens vestem nuptialem? At ille obmutuit.
verses.english: He said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without a wedding garment?’ And the man was speechless.

verses.latin: Tunc dixit rex ministris: Alligate pedes et manus ejus, et mittite eum in tenebras exteriores: ibi erit fletus et stridor dentium.
verses.english: Then the king said to his attendants, ‘Tie him hand and foot and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.’

verses.latin: Multi enim sunt vocati, pauci vero electi.
verses.english: For many are called, but few are chosen.”

verses.latin: Tunc abeuntes pharisæi, consilium inierunt ut eum caperent in verbo.
verses.english: Then the Pharisees went off and plotted how to trap Jesus in what he said.

verses.latin: Et mittunt ei discipulos suos cum Herodianis, dicentes: Magister, scimus quia verax es, et viam Dei in veritate doces, et non es curans de aliquo: non enim respicis faciem hominis.
verses.english: They sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and teach the way of God in accordance with the truth, and you are not concerned with anyone’s opinion, for you do not regard a person’s status.

verses.latin: Dic ergo nobis, quid tibi videtur? Licet dari tributum Cæsari, an non?
verses.english: So tell us your opinion: Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

verses.latin: Cognita autem Jesus nequitia eorum, ait: Quid me tentatis, hypocritæ?
verses.english: But Jesus, aware of their malice, said, “Why are you putting me to the test, you hypocrites?

verses.latin: Ostendite mihi nummum tributi. At illi obtulerunt ei denarium.
verses.english: Show me the coin used for the tax.” And they brought him a denarius.

verses.latin: Et ait illis Jesus: Cujus est imago hæc, et superscriptio?
verses.english: Then he said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Cæsaris. Tunc ait illis: Reddite ergo quæ Cæsaris sunt, Cæsari: et quæ Dei sunt, Deo.
verses.english: They replied, “Caesar’s.” Then he said to them, “So give to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”

verses.latin: Et audientes mirati sunt: et relicto eo, abierunt.
verses.english: When they heard this, they were amazed, and they left him and went away.

verses.latin: In illa die accesserunt ad eum Sadducæi, qui dicunt non esse resurrectionem: et interrogaverunt eum,
verses.english: On that day, the Sadducees came to him, saying that there is no resurrection, and they questioned him,

verses.latin: dicentes: Magister, Moyses dixit: Si quis mortuus fuerit, non habens filios, ut fratres ejus accipiant uxorem ejus, et suscitent semen fratris sui.
verses.english: saying, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies without having children, his brother must take the wife and raise up offspring for his brother.’

verses.latin: Erant autem apud nos septem fratres: et primus, uxorem duxit, et mortuus est: et non habens filium, reliquit uxorem suo fratri.
verses.english: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

verses.latin: Similiter secundus, et tertius, usque ad septimum.
verses.english: The same happened with the second and the third, down to the seventh.

verses.latin: Novissime autem omnium, et mulier mortua est.
verses.english: Finally, the woman died.

verses.latin: In resurrectione ergo, cujus erit de septem uxor? omnes enim habuerunt eam.
verses.english: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For all seven had been married to her.”

verses.latin: Respondens Jesus, ait illis: Erratis, nescientes Scripturas, neque virtutem Dei.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God.

verses.latin: In resurrectione enim, neque nubent, neque nubentur: sed erunt sicut angeli Dei in cælo.
verses.english: For in the resurrection, people will neither marry nor be given in marriage, but they will be like the angels of God in the universe.

verses.latin: De resurrectione autem mortuorum, non legistis quod dictum est vobis a Deo, dicens:
verses.english: And as for the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God, who said:

verses.latin: Ego sum Deus Abraham, et Deus Isaac, et Deus Jacob? Non est Deus mortuorum, sed viventium.
verses.english: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”

verses.latin: Et audientes, turba mirabantur in doctrina ejus.
verses.english: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.

verses.latin: Pharisæi autem audientes quod silentium imposuisset Sadducæis, convenerunt in unum.
verses.english: But when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.

verses.latin: Et interrogavit eum unus ex eis legis doctor, tentans eum:
verses.english: And one of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:

verses.latin: Magister, quod est mandatum magnum in lege?
verses.english: “Teacher, which commandment in the law is the greatest?”

verses.latin: Ait illi Jesus: Diliges Dominum Deum tuum ex toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua, et in tota mente tua.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.”

verses.latin: Hoc est maximum, et primum mandatum.
verses.english: This is the greatest and first commandment.

verses.latin: Secundum autem simile est huic: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum.
verses.english: And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

verses.latin: In his duobus mandatis universa lex pendet, et prophetæ.
verses.english: On these two commandments depend all the law and the prophets.”

verses.latin: Collectis autem pharisæis, interrogavit eos Jesus,
verses.english: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

verses.latin: dicens: Quid vobis videtur de Christo? cujus filius est?
verses.english: saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?”

verses.latin: Dicunt ei: Davidis.
verses.english: They said to him, “David’s.”

verses.latin: Ait illis: Quomodo ergo David in Spiritu vocat eum Dominum, dicens:
verses.english: He said to them, “Then how is it that David, in the Spirit, calls him Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis, donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum?
verses.english: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.”’

verses.latin: Si ergo David vocat eum Dominum, quomodo filius ejus est?
verses.english: If then David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”

verses.latin: Et nemo poterat respondere ei verbum: neque ausus est quisquam ex illa die eum amplius interrogare.
verses.english: No one could answer him a word, and from that day on no one dared to question him any further.

verses.latin: Tunc Jesus locutus est ad turbas, et ad discipulos suos,
verses.english: Jesus then spoke to the crowds of people and to His disciples,

verses.latin: dicens: Super cathedram Moysi sederunt scribae et pharisaei.
verses.english: saying, "The scribes and the Pharisees have taken their place as the official teachers of Moses' Law."

verses.latin: Omnia ergo quaecumque dixerint vobis servate, et facite: secundum opera vero eorum nolite facere: dicunt enim, et non faciunt.
verses.english: Therefore, you must observe and do everything they tell you, because they teach God's Law. But do not live according to their works, for they say one thing and do not practice what they preach.

verses.latin: Alligant enim onera gravia, et importabilia, et imponunt in humeros hominum: digito autem suo nolunt ea movere.
verses.english: They tie up heavy, burdensome loads of rules and regulations and place them on people's shoulders. But they themselves are unwilling to move these burdens with even a single finger.

verses.latin: Omnia vero opera sua faciunt ut videantur ab hominibus: dilatant enim phylacteria sua, et magnificant fimbrias.
verses.english: All of their works are done to be seen and admired by other people. They make their phylacteries very broad—these are the small boxes containing Scripture worn on the forehead and arm during prayer—and they make the fringes of their garments very long.

verses.latin: Amant primos recubitus in coenis, et primas cathedras in synagogis,
verses.english: They love the places of honor at dinner parties and the most prominent seats in the synagogues, which are places of worship and community gathering.

verses.latin: et salutationes in foro, et vocari ab hominibus Rabbi.
verses.english: They love greetings of respect in the marketplaces, and they love to be called 'Rabbi'—meaning 'my great one' or 'my master'—by people.

verses.latin: Vos autem nolite vocari Rabbi: unus est enim magister vester, Christus: omnes autem vos fratres estis.
verses.english: But you, my followers, must not allow yourselves to be called 'Rabbi,' for only one is your Master, who is Christ. All of you are brothers and sisters in Christ.

verses.latin: Et patrem nolite vocare vobis super terram: unus est enim pater vester qui in caelis est.
verses.english: Do not call anyone on earth your 'father' in a spiritual sense, for you have only one Father, who is in heaven.

verses.latin: Nec vocemini magistri: quia magister vester unus est, Christus.
verses.english: Nor are you to be called 'teachers' or 'guides' in this way, for your one and only true Teacher is Christ.

verses.latin: Qui major est vestrum, erit minister vester.
verses.english: Whoever is greatest among you must be your servant.

verses.latin: Humiliaverit se, exaltabitur: et qui se exaltaverit, humiliabitur.
verses.english: For whoever humbles himself will be exalted by God. And whoever exalts himself will be humbled by God.

verses.latin: Vae autem vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: quia clauditis regnum caelorum ante homines. Vos enim non intratis, nec introeuntes sinitis intrare.
verses.english: But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you shut the kingdom of heaven in people's faces. You yourselves do not enter it, nor do you allow those who are trying to enter to go in.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae, quia comeditis domos viduarum, orationes longas orantes: propter hoc amplius judicium accipietis.
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you devour widows' houses—meaning you exploit and steal from vulnerable women—while making long, showy prayers. Because of this, you will receive a greater judgment from God.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: quia circuitis mare, et aridam ut faciatis unum proselytum: et cum factus fuerit, facitis eum filium Gehennae duplo quam vos.
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you travel across the sea and the dry land to make one convert to Judaism. And when he is made a convert, you make him twice as much a child of Gehenna—a place of eternal punishment and destruction—as yourselves.

verses.latin: Vae vobis duces caeci, qui dicitis: Quicumque juraverit per templum, nihil est: qui autem juraverit per aurum templi, debet.
verses.english: Woe to you, you blind guides! You teach, 'Whoever swears an oath by the Temple, it means nothing. But whoever swears an oath by the gold of the Temple, that oath is binding.'

verses.latin: Stulti et caeci: quid enim majus est, aurum, an templum, quod sanctificat aurum?
verses.english: You are foolish and blind! For which is greater: the gold, or the Temple that makes the gold sacred?

verses.latin: Et quicumque juraverit per altare, nihil est: quicumque autem juraverit in munere, quod est super illud, debet.
verses.english: And you also say, 'Whoever swears an oath by the altar, it means nothing. But whoever swears an oath by the gift that is on the altar, that oath is binding.'

verses.latin: Caeci: quid enim majus est, munus, an altare quod sanctificat munus?
verses.english: You are blind! For which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

verses.latin: Qui ergo jurat in altari, jurat in eo, et in omnibus quae super illud sunt.
verses.english: Therefore, whoever swears an oath by the altar is swearing an oath by it and by everything that is on it.

verses.latin: Et quicumque juraverit in templo, jurat in illo, et in eo qui habitat in illo.
verses.english: And whoever swears an oath by the Temple is swearing an oath by it and by God, who dwells within it.

verses.latin: Et qui jurat in caelo, jurat in throno Dei, et in eo qui sedet super eum.
verses.english: And whoever swears an oath by heaven is swearing an oath by God's throne and by God Himself, who sits upon it.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: quia decimatis mentam, et anethum, et cyminum, et reliquistis quae graviora sunt legis: judicium, et misericordiam, et fidem. Haec oportuit facere, et illa non omittere.
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you carefully tithe even the smallest garden herbs like mint, dill, and cumin. Yet you have neglected the more important matters of the Law: justice, mercy, and faithfulness to God. You ought to have practiced these weightier matters without neglecting the others.

verses.latin: Duces caeci, excolantes culicem, camelum autem glutientes.
verses.english: You blind guides! You strain out a gnat from your drink, yet you swallow a camel. This means you obsess over minor rules but ignore major commands of God.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: quia mundatis quod deforis est calicis et paropsidis: intus autem pleni estis rapina et immunditia.
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside, they are full of greed, extortion, and impurity.

verses.latin: Pharisaee caece, munda prius quod intus est calicis, et paropsidis, ut fiat id quod deforis est mundum.
verses.english: You blind Pharisee! First, clean the inside of the cup and the dish, so that the outside may also become truly clean. This is about inner spiritual purity before outward appearance.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: quia similes estis sepulchris dealbatis, quae a foris quidem parent hominibus speciosa, intus vero plena sunt ossibus mortuorum, et omni spurcitia.
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which appear beautiful and clean on the outside to people. But inside, they are full of the bones of the dead and every kind of filth and impurity.

verses.latin: Sic et vos a foris quidem paretis hominibus justi: intus autem pleni estis hypocrisi et iniquitate.
verses.english: In the same way, on the outside, you appear righteous to people. But inside, you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

verses.latin: Vae vobis scribae et pharisaei, hypocritae: qui aedificatis sepulchra prophetarum, et ornatis monumenta justorum,
verses.english: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! For you build tombs for the prophets and decorate the memorials of the righteous.

verses.latin: et dicitis: Si fuissemus in diebus patrum nostrorum, non essemus socii eorum in sanguine prophetarum.
verses.english: And you say, 'If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have participated with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.'

verses.latin: Itaque testificamini vobismetipsis, quia filii estis eorum qui prophetas occiderunt.
verses.english: So you yourselves bear witness against yourselves that you are indeed the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

verses.latin: Et vos implete mensuram patrum vestrorum.
verses.english: Go on, then, and fill up the measure of your ancestors' guilt.

verses.latin: Serpentes, progenies viperarum, quomodo fugietis a judicio Gehennae?
verses.english: You serpents, you brood of vipers! How will you escape the judgment of Gehenna—the place of eternal punishment?

verses.latin: Ideo ecce ego mitto ad vos prophetas, et sapientes, et scribas, et ex illis occidetis, et crucifigetis, et ex eis flagellabitis in synagogis vestris, et persequemini de civitate in civitatem:
verses.english: Therefore, behold, I am sending to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will flog in your synagogues, and you will persecute them from city to city.

verses.latin: ut veniat super vos omnis sanguis justus, qui effusus est super terram, a sanguine Abel justi, usque ad sanguinem Zachariae filii Barachiae, quem occidistis inter templum et altare.
verses.english: This is so that all the righteous blood shed on the earth may come upon you, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the Temple and the altar.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, venient haec omnia super generationem istam.
verses.english: Truly, I tell you, all these things will come upon this present generation.

verses.latin: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, quae occidis prophetas, et lapidas eos qui ad te missi sunt, quoties volui congregare filios tuos, quemadmodum gallina congregat pullos suos sub alas, et noluisti?
verses.english: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I longed to gather your children together, just as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were unwilling to let me!

verses.latin: Ecce relinquetur vobis domus vestra deserta.
verses.english: Behold, your house—meaning your Temple and your city—is being left to you desolate and deserted.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, non me videbitis amodo, donec dicatis: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini.
verses.english: For I tell you, you will not see Me again from now on until you say, 'Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Et egressus Jesus de templo, ibat. Et accesserunt discipuli ejus ut ostenderent ei ædificationes templi.
verses.english: And as Jesus was leaving the Temple, He was going away. Then His disciples came to Him to show Him the buildings of the Temple.

verses.latin: Ipse autem respondens, dixit illis: Videtis hæc omnia? amen dico vobis, non relinquetur hic lapis super lapidem, qui non destruatur.
verses.english: But He, answering, said to them: "Do you see all these things? Truly, I tell you, not a single stone will be left here upon another stone that will not be thrown down (destroyed)."

verses.latin: Et cum sederet super montem Oliveti, accesserunt ad eum discipuli secreto, dicentes: Dic nobis, quando ista fient? et quod signum adventus tui, et consummationis sæculi?
verses.english: And as He was sitting on the Mount of Olives, His disciples came to Him privately, saying: "Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age (the completion of time as we know it)?"

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, dixit eis: Videte ne quis vos seducat:
verses.english: And Jesus, answering, said to them: "Be careful that no one misleads you:

verses.latin: multi enim venient in nomine meo, dicentes: Ego sum Christus: et multos seducent.
verses.english: for many will come in my name, saying: 'I am the Anointed One (the Christ)!' and they will mislead many people.

verses.latin: Audituri enim estis prælia, et opiniones præliorum. Videte ne turbemini: oportet enim hæc fieri, sed nondum est finis.
verses.english: For you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not alarmed; for it is necessary for these things to happen, but the end is not yet.

verses.latin: Consurget enim gens in gentem, et regnum in regnum, et erunt pestilentiæ, et fames, et terræmotus in locis:
verses.english: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be plagues (diseases), and famines, and earthquakes in various places:

verses.latin: hæc autem omnia principia sunt dolorum.
verses.english: but all these things are only the beginning of sorrows (or birth pangs).

verses.latin: Tunc tradent vos in pressuram, et occident vos, et eritis odio omnibus gentibus propter nomen meum.
verses.english: Then they will hand you over to tribulation, and they will kill you; and you will be hated by all nations because of my name.

verses.latin: Et tunc scandalizabuntur multi, et invicem tradent, et odio habebunt invicem.
verses.english: And then many will be scandalized (will fall away from the faith into sin or unbelief), and they will betray one another, and they will hate one another.

verses.latin: Et multi pseudoprophetæ surgent, et seducent multos.
verses.english: And many false prophets will rise up, and they will mislead many.

verses.latin: Et quoniam abundavit iniquitas, refrigescet caritas multorum.
verses.english: And because wickedness has abounded (will increase greatly), the charity (the supernatural love for God and neighbor) of many will grow cold.

verses.latin: Qui autem perseveraverit usque in finem, hic salvus erit.
verses.english: But he who perseveres (remains steadfast in faith and good works) to the end will be saved.

verses.latin: Et prædicabitur hoc Evangelium regni in universo orbe, in testimonium omnibus gentibus: et tunc veniet consummatio.
verses.english: And this Gospel (Good News) of the Kingdom will be preached throughout the whole world (the entire planet), as a testimony to all nations: and then the end (the consummation of all things) will come.

verses.latin: Cum ergo videritis abominationem desolationis, quæ dicta est a Daniele propheta, stantem in loco sancto, qui legit, intelligat:
verses.english: Therefore, when you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place — whoever reads, let him understand:

verses.latin: tunc qui in Judæa sunt, fugiant ad montes:
verses.english: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains:

verses.latin: et qui in tecto, non descendat tollere aliquid de domo sua:
verses.english: and let him who is on the housetop (the flat roof of his house) not come down to take anything from his house:

verses.latin: et qui in agro, non revertatur tollere tunicam suam.
verses.english: and let him who is in the field not return to get his cloak.

verses.latin: Væ autem prægnantibus, et nutrientibus in illis diebus!
verses.english: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing infants in those days!

verses.latin: Orate autem ut non fiat fuga vestra hieme, vel sabbato:
verses.english: And pray that your flight (fleeing) may not be in winter, or on the Sabbath (when travel was restricted by religious law):

verses.latin: erit enim tunc tribulatio magna, qualis non fuit ab initio mundi usque modo, neque fiet.
verses.english: For then there will be great tribulation, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, nor ever will be.

verses.latin: Et nisi breviati fuissent dies illi, non fieret salva omnis caro: sed propter electos breviabuntur dies illi.
verses.english: And unless those days had been shortened, no living thing (no human life) would be saved: but for the sake of the elect (God's chosen people) those days will be shortened.

verses.latin: Tunc si quis vobis dixerit: Ecce hic est Christus, aut illic, nolite credere.
verses.english: Then if anyone says to you: 'Look, here is the Anointed One (the Christ)!' or 'There!', do not believe it.

verses.latin: Surgent enim pseudochristi, et pseudoprophetæ: et dabunt signa magna, et prodigia, ita ut in errorem inducantur, si fieri potest, etiam electi.
verses.english: For false Anointed Ones (false Christs) and false prophets will arise: and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to mislead, if it were possible, even the elect (God's chosen people).

verses.latin: Ecce prædixi vobis.
verses.english: Behold, I have told you beforehand.

verses.latin: Si ergo dixerint vobis: Ecce in deserto est, nolite exire: Ecce in penetralibus, nolite credere.
verses.english: Therefore, if they say to you: 'Look, He is in the desert!' do not go out: 'Look, He is in the inner rooms (secret chambers)!' do not believe it.

verses.latin: Sicut enim fulgur exit ab Oriente, et paret usque in Occidentem: ita erit et adventus Filii hominis.
verses.english: For just as lightning comes from the East and flashes even to the West across the sky: so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.latin: Ubicumque fuerit corpus, illuc congregabuntur et aquilæ.
verses.english: Wherever the dead body (carrion) is, there the eagles (vultures) will gather.

verses.latin: Statim autem post tribulationem dierum illorum, sol obscurabitur, et luna non dabit lumen suum, et stellæ cadent de cælo, et virtutes cælorum commovebuntur.
verses.english: But immediately after the tribulation of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky (the visible cosmos), and the celestial powers (the spiritual forces of the heavens) will be shaken.

verses.latin: Et tunc parebit signum Filii hominis in cælo: et tunc plangent omnes tribus terræ: et videbunt Filium hominis venientem in nubibus cæli, cum virtute multa, et majestate.
verses.english: And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky: and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn (lament): and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky, with great power and majesty.

verses.latin: Et mittet Angelos suos cum tuba, et voce magna: et congregabunt electos ejus a quatuor ventis, a summis cælorum usque ad terminos eorum.
verses.english: And He will send His Angels with a trumpet call and a loud voice: and they will gather His elect (His chosen people) from the four winds (from all directions), from one end of the universe to the other (from the highest reaches of the cosmos to its very ends).

verses.latin: Ab arbore autem fici discite parabolam: Cum jam ramus ejus mollis sit, et folia nata fuerint, scitis quia prope est æstas:
verses.english: Now learn a parable (a lesson) from the fig tree: When its branch is already tender and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near:

verses.latin: ita et vos cum videritis hæc omnia, scitote quia prope est in foribus.
verses.english: So also, when you see all these things, know that He (the time of His coming) is near, at the doors.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quia non præteribit generatio hæc, donec omnia hæc fiant.
verses.english: Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things have happened (come to pass).

verses.latin: Caelum et terra transibunt, verba autem mea non præteribunt.
verses.english: The universe and the earth will pass away (will come to an end), but my words will not pass away (will endure forever).

verses.latin: De die autem illa et hora nemo scit, neque Angeli cælorum, nisi solus Pater.
verses.english: But concerning that day and hour, no one knows, not even the Angels of the heavens (the spiritual realms), but the Father alone.

verses.latin: Sicut autem dies Noë, ita erit et adventus Filii hominis.
verses.english: For just as were the days of Noah, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.latin: Sicut enim erant in diebus ante diluvium comedentes et bibentes, nubentes et nuptum tradentes, usque ad eum diem quo introivit Noë in arcam,
verses.english: For as they were in the days before the flood, eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark,

verses.latin: et non cognoverunt donec venit diluvium, et tulit omnes: ita erit et adventus Filii hominis.
verses.english: and they did not understand (or know) until the flood came and swept them all away: so also will be the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.latin: Tunc duo erunt in agro: unus assumetur, et alter relinquetur.
verses.english: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken (assumed to God), and the other will be left behind.

verses.latin: Duæ molentes in mola: una assumetur, et una relinquetur.
verses.english: Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken (assumed to God), and one will be left behind.

verses.latin: Vigilate ergo, quia nescitis qua hora Dominus vester venturus sit.
verses.english: Therefore, be vigilant (keep watch), for you do not know at what hour your Lord is coming.

verses.latin: Illud autem scitote, quoniam si sciret paterfamilias qua hora fur veniret, vigilaret utique, et non sineret perfodi domum suam.
verses.english: But know this, that if the master of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would certainly have kept watch, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into (dug through).

verses.latin: Ideo et vos estote parati: quia qua hora non putatis, Filius hominis veniet.
verses.english: Therefore, you also be ready: for at an hour you do not expect, the Son of Man will come.

verses.latin: Quis, putas, est fidelis servus et prudens, quem constituit Dominus suus super familiam suam, ut det illis cibum in tempore?
verses.english: Who then, do you think, is the faithful and prudent (wise) servant, whom his master has set over his household (his family), to give them food at the proper time?

verses.latin: Beatus ille servus, quem cum venerit Dominus ejus, invenerit ita facientem.
verses.english: Blessed is that servant whom his master, when he comes, will find doing so (carrying out his duty faithfully).

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quoniam super omnia bona sua constituet eum.
verses.english: Truly, I say to you, he will set him over all his possessions (all his property).

verses.latin: Si autem dixerit malus servus in corde suo: Moram facit Dominus meus venire:
verses.english: But if that wicked servant says in his heart: 'My master delays his coming (is taking a long time to return):'

verses.latin: et cœperit percutere conservos suos, et manducare et bibere cum ebriosis:
verses.english: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with drunkards:

verses.latin: veniet Dominus servi illius in die qua non sperat, et hora qua ignorat:
verses.english: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him, and at an hour when he does not know (is unaware):

verses.latin: et dividet eum, partemque ejus ponet cum hypocritis. Ibi erit fletus et stridor dentium.
verses.english: and will cut him in pieces (severely punish him), and appoint his portion with the hypocrites. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.latin: Tunc simile erit regnum caelorum decem virginibus, quae accipientes lampades suas exierunt obviam sponso.
verses.english: At that time, the Kingdom of God will be compared to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

verses.latin: Quinque autem ex eis erant fatuae, et quinque prudentes.
verses.english: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

verses.latin: Fatuae vero, acceptis lampadibus suis, non sumpserunt oleum secum:
verses.english: The foolish ones, when they took their lamps, did not take any oil for them.

verses.latin: prudentes vero acceperunt oleum in vasis suis cum lampadibus.
verses.english: But the wise ones took oil in their containers along with their lamps.

verses.latin: Mora autem faciente sponso, dormitaverunt omnes et dormierunt.
verses.english: As the bridegroom was delayed, all of them became drowsy and fell asleep.

verses.latin: Media autem nocte clamor factus est: Ecce sponsus venit, exite obviam ei.
verses.english: But at midnight, a shout was heard: 'Behold, the bridegroom is coming! Go out to meet him!'

verses.latin: Tunc surrexerunt omnes virgines illae, et ornaverunt lampades suas.
verses.english: Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps, preparing them to burn brightly.

verses.latin: Fatuae autem sapientibus dixerunt: Date nobis de oleo vestro, quia lampades nostrae extinguuntur.
verses.english: But the foolish ones said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.'

verses.latin: Responderunt prudentes, dicentes: Ne forte non sufficiat nobis, et vobis, ite potius ad vendentes, et emite vobis.
verses.english: The wise ones answered, saying, 'No, there probably won't be enough for us and for you. Instead, go to those who sell and buy some for yourselves.'

verses.latin: Dum irent autem emere, venit sponsus: et quae paratae erant, intraverunt cum eo ad nuptias, et clausa est janua.
verses.english: While they were on their way to buy, the bridegroom arrived. And those who were prepared went in with him to the wedding feast, and then the door was shut.

verses.latin: Novissime vero veniunt et reliquae virgines, dicentes: Domine, domine, aperi nobis.
verses.english: Finally, the other virgins also came, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open the door for us!'

verses.latin: At ille respondens, ait: Amen dico vobis, nescio vos.
verses.english: But he answered, saying, 'Truly, I tell you, I do not know you.'

verses.latin: Vigilate itaque, quia nescitis diem, neque horam.
verses.english: Therefore, stay awake and be vigilant, because you do not know the day nor the hour of My return.

verses.latin: Sicut enim homo peregre proficiscens, vocavit servos suos, et tradidit illis bona sua.
verses.english: For it is just like a man who, going on a journey, called his servants and entrusted his possessions to them.

verses.latin: Et uni quidem dedit quinque talenta, alii autem duo, alii vero unum, unicuique secundum propriam virtutem: et protinus profectus est.
verses.english: To one, he gave five talents—a very large sum of money or skill. To another, he gave two, and to another, one, to each according to his own ability. And then he immediately left on his journey.

verses.latin: Abiit autem qui quinque talenta acceperat, et operatus est in illis, et lucratus est alia quinque.
verses.english: Then the one who had received five talents immediately went and traded with them, and he gained another five talents.

verses.latin: Similiter et qui duo acceperat, lucratus est alia duo.
verses.english: Similarly, the one who had received two talents also gained another two.

verses.latin: Ille vero qui unum acceperat, abiit et fodit in terram, et abscondit pecuniam domini sui.
verses.english: But the one who had received one talent went and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money there.

verses.latin: Post multum vero temporis venit dominus servorum illorum, et posuit rationem cum eis.
verses.english: Now, after a long time, the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them, requiring each to explain how they used what was given to them.

verses.latin: Et accedens qui quinque talenta acceperat, obtulit alia quinque talenta, dicens: Domine, quinque talenta tradidisti mihi, ecce alia quinque superlucratus sum.
verses.english: And the one who had received five talents came forward and brought another five talents, saying, 'Master, you entrusted five talents to me. Behold, I have gained another five on top of that amount!'

verses.latin: Ait illi dominus suus: Euge bone serve, et fidelis, quia super pauca fuisti fidelis, super multa te constituam: intra in gaudium domini tui.
verses.english: His master said to him, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! Because you have been faithful in a few things, I will set you over many things. Come, enter into the joy of your master!'

verses.latin: Accessit autem et qui duo talenta acceperat, et ait: Domine, duo talenta tradidisti mihi, ecce alia duo superlucratus sum.
verses.english: Then the one who had received two talents also came forward and said, 'Master, you entrusted two talents to me. Behold, I have gained another two on top of that amount!'

verses.latin: Ait illi dominus suus: Euge bone serve, et fidelis, quia super pauca fuisti fidelis, super multa te constituam: intra in gaudium domini tui.
verses.english: His master said to him, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! Because you have been faithful in a few things, I will set you over many things. Come, enter into the joy of your master!'

verses.latin: Accessit autem et qui unum talentum acceperat, et ait: Domine, scio quia durus es homo: metis ubi non seminasti, et congregas ubi non sparsisti.
verses.english: Then the one who had received one talent also came forward and said, 'Master, I knew that you are a harsh man. You reap where you have not sown, and you gather where you have not scattered any seed.'

verses.latin: Et timens abii, et abscondi talentum tuum in terra: ecce habes quod tuum est.
verses.english: And so, out of fear, I went away and hid your talent in the ground. Behold, here you have what is yours back again.

verses.latin: Respondens autem dominus ejus, dixit illi: Serve male, et piger, sciebas quia meto ubi non semino, et congrego ubi non sparsi:
verses.english: But his master answered and said to him, 'You wicked and lazy servant! You knew that I reap where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered!'

verses.latin: oportuit ergo te pecuniam meam committere numulariis, et ego veniens recepissem utique quod meum est cum usura.
verses.english: Therefore, you should have entrusted my money to the bankers, and then, when I returned, I would have received what is mine with interest, a profit on my investment.

verses.latin: Tollite itaque ab illo talentum, et date ei qui habet decem talenta.
verses.english: So, take the talent from him and give it to the one who has ten talents.

verses.latin: Omni enim habenti dabitur, et abundabit: ei autem qui non habet, et quod videtur habere, auferetur ab eo.
verses.english: For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have an abundance. But from the one who does not have, even what he seems to have will be taken away from him.

verses.latin: Et inutilem servum ejicite in tenebras exteriores: illic erit fletus et stridor dentium.
verses.english: And cast this useless servant into the outer darkness, the place of suffering and separation from God. There, there will be weeping and grinding of teeth in despair.

verses.latin: Cum autem venerit Filius hominis in majestate sua, et omnes Angeli cum eo, tunc sedebit super sedem majestatis suae:
verses.english: When the Son of Man comes in His divine majesty, and all the Angels are with Him, then He will sit upon the throne of His glory.

verses.latin: et congregabuntur ante eum omnes gentes, et separabit eos ab invicem, sicut pastor segregat oves ab haedis:
verses.english: And all the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them from one another, just as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

verses.latin: et statuet oves quidem a dextris suis, haedos autem a sinistris.
verses.english: And He will place the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on His left.

verses.latin: Tunc dicet Rex his qui a dextris ejus erunt: Venite benedicti Patris mei, possidete paratum vobis regnum a constitutione mundi.
verses.english: Then the King will say to those on His right hand, 'Come, you who are blessed by My Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the very foundation of the world.'

verses.latin: Esurivi enim, et dedistis mihi manducare: sitivi, et dedistis mihi bibere: hospes eram, et collegistis me:
verses.english: For I was hungry, and you gave Me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave Me drink. I was a stranger, a foreigner in your land, and you welcomed Me into your home.

verses.latin: nudus, et operuistis me: infirmus, et visitastis me: in carcere eram, et venistis ad me.
verses.english: I was naked, and you clothed Me. I was sick, and you visited Me. I was in prison, and you came to Me.

verses.latin: Tunc respondebunt ei justi, dicentes: Domine, quando te vidimus esurientem, et pavimus te: sitientem, et dedimus tibi potum?
verses.english: Then the righteous will answer Him, saying, 'Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and give You drink?'

verses.latin: aut quando te vidimus hospitem, et collegimus te? aut nudum, et cooperuimus te?
verses.english: Or when did we see You a stranger and welcome You in, or naked and clothe You?

verses.latin: aut quando te vidimus infirmum, aut in carcere, et venimus ad te?
verses.english: Or when did we see You sick or in prison and come to You?

verses.latin: Et respondens Rex, dicet illis: Amen dico vobis: Quamdiu fecistis uni ex his fratribus meis minimis, mihi fecistis.
verses.english: And the King will answer and say to them, 'Truly, I tell you, just as you did it for one of the least of these, My brothers and sisters in faith, you did it for Me.'

verses.latin: Tunc dicet et his qui a sinistris erunt: Discedite a me maledicti in ignem aeternum, qui paratus est diabolo, et angelis ejus:
verses.english: Then He will also say to those on His left, 'Depart from Me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire which was prepared for the devil and his angels, not for you.'

verses.latin: esurivi enim, et non dedistis mihi manducare: sitivi, et non dedistis mihi potum:
verses.english: For I was hungry, and you gave Me no food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave Me no drink.

verses.latin: hospes eram, et non collegistis me: nudus, et non operuistis me: infirmus, et in carcere, et non visitastis me.
verses.english: I was a stranger, a foreigner, and you did not welcome Me in. I was naked, and you did not clothe Me. I was sick and in prison, and you did not visit Me.

verses.latin: Tunc respondebunt ei, et ipsi, dicentes: Domine, quando te vidimus esurientem, aut sitientem, aut hospitem, aut nudum, aut infirmum, aut in carcere, et non ministravimus tibi?
verses.english: Then they also will answer Him, saying, 'Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and fail to minister to Your needs?'

verses.latin: Tunc respondebit illis, dicens: Amen dico vobis: Quamdiu non fecistis uni de minoribus his, nec mihi fecistis.
verses.english: Then He will answer them, saying, 'Truly, I tell you, just as you did not do it for one of the least of these My brothers and sisters, you did not do it for Me.'

verses.latin: Et ibunt hi in supplicium aeternum: justi autem in vitam aeternam.
verses.english: And these will go away into eternal punishment, the ultimate consequence of their choices, but the righteous will go into eternal life, the unending union with God.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum consummasset Jesus sermones hos omnes, dixit discipulis suis:
verses.english: It came to pass that when Jesus had finished all these discourses, He said to His disciples:

verses.latin: Scitis quia post biduum Pascha fiet, et Filius hominis tradetur ut crucifigatur.
verses.english: “You know that the Passover is coming in two days, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to be crucified.”

verses.latin: Tunc congregati sunt principes sacerdotum, et seniores populi in atrium principis sacerdotum, qui dicebatur Caiphas:
verses.english: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people gathered in the courtyard of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas.

verses.latin: et consilium fecerunt ut Jesum dolo tenerent, et occiderent.
verses.english: And they formed a plan to seize Jesus by cunning and kill Him.

verses.latin: Dicebant autem: Non in die festo, ne forte tumultus fieret in populo.
verses.english: However, they were saying: “Not during the festival, lest there be a riot among the people.”

verses.latin: Cum autem Jesus esset in Bethania in domo Simonis leprosi,
verses.english: Now, when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

verses.latin: accessit ad eum mulier habens alabastrum unguenti pretiosi, et effudit super caput ipsius recumbentis.
verses.english: a woman came to Him with an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment, and she poured it over His head as He was reclining at the table.

verses.latin: Videntes autem discipuli indignati sunt, dicentes: Ut quid perditio hæc?
verses.english: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying: “Why this waste?

verses.latin: potuit enim hoc unguentum venundari multo, et dari pauperibus.
verses.english: This ointment could have been sold for a large sum and given to the poor.”

verses.latin: Sciens autem Jesus, ait illis: Quid molesti estis huic mulieri? Opus enim bonum operata est in me.
verses.english: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said to them: “Why are you troubling this woman? For she has done a good work for me.

verses.latin: Nam semper pauperes habetis vobiscum: me autem non semper habetis.
verses.english: For you always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.

verses.latin: Hoc enim unguentum mittens in corpus meum, ad sepeliendum me fecit.
verses.english: For by pouring this ointment on my body, she has done this as preparation for my burial.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, ubicumque prædicatum fuerit hoc Evangelium in universo mundo, dicetur et quod hæc fecit in memoriam ejus.
verses.english: Amen, I say to you, wherever this Gospel is preached in the whole world, what she has done will also be spoken of in memory of her.”

verses.latin: Tunc abiit unus de duodecim, qui dicebatur Judas Iscariotes, ad principes sacerdotum,
verses.english: Then one of the twelve disciples, named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests.

verses.latin: et ait illis: Quid vultis mihi dare, et ego vobis eum tradam? At illi constituerunt ei triginta argenteos.
verses.english: And he said to them: “What are you willing to give me, and I will deliver Him to you?” And they weighed out and agreed to give him thirty pieces of silver.

verses.latin: Et ex illo quærebat opportunitatem ut eum traderet.
verses.english: And from that time on, he sought an opportunity to betray Jesus.

verses.latin: Prima autem die azymorum accesserunt discipuli ad Jesum, dicentes: Ubi vis paremus tibi comedere Pascha?
verses.english: Now, on the first day of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying: “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”

verses.latin: At Jesus dixit: Ite in civitatem ad quemdam, et dicite ei: Magister dicit: Tempus meum prope est, apud te facio Pascha cum discipulis meis.
verses.english: But Jesus said: “Go into the city to a certain man and say to him: ‘The Teacher says: My time is near; I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.’”

verses.latin: Et fecerunt discipuli sicut constituit illis Jesus, et paraverunt Pascha.
verses.english: And the disciples did as Jesus had instructed them, and they prepared the Passover.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto, discumbebat cum duodecim discipulis.
verses.english: When evening came, He was reclining at table with the twelve disciples.

verses.latin: Et edentibus illis, dixit: Amen dico vobis, quia unus ex vobis me traditurus est.
verses.english: And as they were eating, He said: “Amen, I say to you, one of you will betray me.”

verses.latin: Et contristati valde, cœperunt singuli dicere: Numquid ego sum, Domine?
verses.english: And they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each one began to say: “Surely it is not I, Lord?”

verses.latin: At ipse respondens, ait: Qui intingit mecum manum in paropside, hic me tradet.
verses.english: But He answered and said: “The one who dips his hand with me into the dish, he will betray me.”

verses.latin: Filius quidem hominis vadit, sicut scriptum est de eo: Væ autem homini illi per quem Filius hominis tradetur: bonum erat ei si natus non fuisset homo ille.
verses.english: “The Son of Man indeed goes, just as it is written concerning Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had never been born.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Judas, qui tradidit eum, dixit: Numquid ego sum, Rabbi? Ait illi Jesus: Tu dixisti.
verses.english: Then Judas, who was betraying Him, responded and said: “Surely it is not I, Rabbi?” Jesus said to him: “You have said it.”

verses.latin: Cœnantibus autem eis, accepit Jesus panem, et benedixit, ac fregit, deditque discipulis suis, et ait: Accipite, et comedite: hoc est corpus meum.
verses.english: Now as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed it, and broke it, and gave it to His disciples, and said: “Take and eat; this is my Body.”

verses.latin: Et accipiens calicem, gratias egit: et dedit illis, dicens: Bibite ex hoc omnes.
verses.english: And taking the chalice, He gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying: “Drink from this, all of you.”

verses.latin: Hic est enim sanguis meus novi testamenti, qui pro multis effundetur in remissionem peccatorum.
verses.english: “For this is my Blood of the New Covenant, which will be poured out for many unto the remission of sins.”

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis: non bibam amodo de hoc genimine vitis, usque in diem illum cum illud bibam vobiscum novum in regno Patris mei.
verses.english: “And I say to you: I will not drink from this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it new with you in the Kingdom of my Father.”

verses.latin: Et hymno dicto, exierunt in montem Oliveti.
verses.english: And after singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.latin: Tunc dicit illis Jesus: Omnes vos scandalum patiemini in me in ista nocte. Scriptum est enim: Percutiam pastorem, et dispergentur oves gregis.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them: “All of you will stumble because of me this very night. For it is written: ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’”

verses.latin: Postquam autem resurrexero, præcedam vos in Galilæam.
verses.english: “But after I have risen, I will go before you into Galilee.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Petrus ait illi: Et si omnes scandalizati fuerint in te, ego nunquam scandalizabor.
verses.english: Peter responded and said to Him: “Even if all others stumble because of you, I will never stumble.”

verses.latin: Ait illi Jesus: Amen dico tibi, quia in hac nocte, antequam gallus cantet, ter me negabis.
verses.english: Jesus said to him: “Amen, I say to you, that on this very night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

verses.latin: Ait illi Petrus: Etiamsi oportuerit me mori tecum, non te negabo. Similiter et omnes discipuli dixerunt.
verses.english: Peter said to Him: “Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you.” And all the disciples said the same.

verses.latin: Tunc venit Jesus cum illis in villam quæ dicitur Gethsemani, et dixit discipulis suis: Sedete hic donec vadam illuc, et orem.
verses.english: Then Jesus came with them to a country estate called Gethsemane, and He said to His disciples: “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

verses.latin: Et assumpto Petro et duobus filiis Zebedæi, cœpit contristari et mœstus esse.
verses.english: And taking Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with Him, He began to be sorrowful and distressed.

verses.latin: Tunc ait illis: Tristis est anima mea usque ad mortem: sustinete hic, et vigilate mecum.
verses.english: Then He said to them: “My soul is sorrowful, even to the point of death. Remain here and keep watch with me.”

verses.latin: Et progressus pusillum, procidit in faciem suam, orans, et dicens: Pater mi, si possibile est, transeat a me calix iste: verumtamen non sicut ego volo, sed sicut tu.
verses.english: And going forward a little, He fell on His face, praying and saying: “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from me. Yet, not as I will, but as you will.”

verses.latin: Et venit ad discipulos suos, et invenit eos dormientes, et dicit Petro: Sic non potuistis una hora vigilare mecum?
verses.english: And He came to His disciples and found them sleeping, and He said to Peter: “So, could you not keep watch with me for one hour?”

verses.latin: Vigilate, et orate ut non intretis in tentationem. Spiritus quidem promptus est, caro autem infirma.
verses.english: “Keep watch and pray, so that you do not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

verses.latin: Iterum secundo abiit, et oravit, dicens: Pater mi, si non potest hic calix transire nisi bibam illum, fiat voluntas tua.
verses.english: Again, a second time, He went away and prayed, saying: “My Father, if this cup cannot pass away unless I drink it, then your will be done.”

verses.latin: Et venit iterum, et invenit illos dormientes: erant enim oculi eorum gravati.
verses.english: And He came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

verses.latin: Et relictis illis, iterum abiit, et oravit tertio, eumdem sermonem dicens.
verses.english: And leaving them again, He went away and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

verses.latin: Tunc venit ad discipulos suos, et dicit illis: Dormite jam, et requiescite: ecce appropinquavit hora, et Filius hominis tradetur in manus peccatorum.
verses.english: Then He came to His disciples and said to them: “Sleep now and take your rest. Behold, the hour has drawn near, and the Son of Man will be delivered into the hands of sinners.”

verses.latin: Surgite, eamus: ecce appropinquavit qui me tradit.
verses.english: “Rise, let us go! Behold, he who is betraying me has drawn near.”

verses.latin: Et adhuc ipso loquente, ecce Judas unus de duodecim venit, et cum eo turba multa cum gladiis et fustibus, a principibus sacerdotum et senioribus populi.
verses.english: And while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests and the elders of the people.

verses.latin: Qui autem tradidit eum, dedit illis signum, dicens: Quemcumque osculatus fuero, ipse est, tenete eum.
verses.english: Now the one who was betraying Him had given them a sign, saying: “Whomever I kiss, that is He; seize Him.”

verses.latin: Et confestim accedens ad Jesum, dixit: Ave Rabbi. Et osculatus est eum.
verses.english: And immediately he came to Jesus and said: “Hail, Rabbi!” And he kissed Him.

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Jesus: Amice, ad quod venisti? Tunc accesserunt, et manus injecerunt in Jesum, et tenuerunt eum.
verses.english: Jesus said to him: “Friend, for what purpose have you come?” Then they came forward, laid hands on Jesus, and seized Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce unus ex his qui erant cum Jesu, extendens manum, exemit gladium suum, et percutiens servum principis sacerdotum amputavit illi auriculam.
verses.english: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand, drew his sword, and striking the servant of the high priest, cut off his ear.

verses.latin: Tunc ait illi Jesus: Converte gladium tuum in locum suum: omnes enim qui acceperint gladium, gladio peribunt.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to him: “Return your sword to its place, for all who take up the sword will perish by the sword.”

verses.latin: An putas quia non possum rogare Patrem meum, et exhibebit mihi modo plus quam duodecim legiones angelorum?
verses.english: “Do you think that I cannot appeal to my Father, and He would immediately send me more than twelve legions of angels?”

verses.latin: Quomodo ergo implebuntur Scripturæ, quia sic oportet fieri?
verses.english: “How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, which say that it must happen in this way?”

verses.latin: In illa hora dixit Jesus turbis: Tamquam ad latronem existis cum gladiis et fustibus comprehendere me? Quotidie apud vos sedebam docens in templo, et non me tenuistis.
verses.english: At that very hour, Jesus said to the crowds: “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs, to apprehend me? Day after day I sat teaching among you in the Temple, and you did not seize me.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem totum factum est, ut implerentur Scripturæ prophetarum. Tunc discipuli omnes relicto eo fugerunt.
verses.english: “But all this has happened so that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples deserted Him and fled.

verses.latin: At illi tenentes Jesum, duxerunt ad Caipham principem sacerdotum, ubi scribæ et seniores convenerant.
verses.english: Then those who had seized Jesus led Him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and elders were gathered.

verses.latin: Petrus autem sequebatur eum a longe, usque in atrium principis sacerdotum. Et ingressus intus, sedebat cum ministris, ut videret finem.
verses.english: But Peter followed Him at a distance, as far as the courtyard of the high priest. And he went inside and sat with the servants to see the outcome.

verses.latin: Principes autem sacerdotum, et omne concilium, quærebant falsum testimonium contra Jesum, ut eum morti traderent:
verses.english: Now the chief priests and the entire council were seeking false testimony against Jesus, so that they might put Him to death.

verses.latin: et non invenerunt, cum multi falsi testes accessissent. Novissime autem venerunt duo falsi testes,
verses.english: But they found none, though many false witnesses came forward. At last, however, two false witnesses came,

verses.latin: et dixerunt: Hic dixit: Possum destruere templum Dei, et post triduum reædificare illud.
verses.english: and they said: “This man said: ‘I can destroy the Temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”

verses.latin: Et surgens princeps sacerdotum, ait illi: Nihil respondes ad ea quæ isti adversum te testificantur?
verses.english: And the high priest stood up and said to Him: “Do you answer nothing concerning what these men testify against you?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem tacebat. Et princeps sacerdotum ait illi: Adjuro te per Deum vivum, ut dicas nobis si tu es Christus Filius Dei.
verses.english: But Jesus remained silent. And the high priest said to Him: “I put you under oath by the Living God, that you tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”

verses.latin: Dicit illi Jesus: Tu dixisti: verumtamen dico vobis, amodo videbitis Filium hominis sedere a dextris virtutis Dei, et venientem in nubibus cæli.
verses.english: Jesus said to him: “You have said it. Nevertheless, I say to you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power of God, and coming on the clouds of the sky.”

verses.latin: Tunc princeps sacerdotum scidit vestimenta sua, dicens: Blasphemavit: quid adhuc egemus testibus? Ecce nunc audistis blasphemiam.
verses.english: Then the high priest tore his garments, saying: “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? Behold, now you have heard the blasphemy.

verses.latin: Quid vobis videtur? At illi respondentes dixerunt: Reus est mortis.
verses.english: What do you think?” And they answered and said: “He is guilty of death.”

verses.latin: Tunc exspuerunt in faciem ejus, et colaphis eum ceciderunt, alii autem palmas in faciem ejus dederunt,
verses.english: Then they spit in His face and struck Him with their fists. Others slapped Him in the face,

verses.latin: dicentes: Prophetiza nobis Christe, quis est qui te percussit?
verses.english: saying: “Prophesy to us, O Christ! Who is it that struck you?”

verses.latin: Petrus vero sedebat foris in atrio: et accessit ad eum una ancilla, dicens: Et tu cum Jesu Galilæo eras.
verses.english: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. And a servant girl came to him, saying: “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”

verses.latin: At ille negavit coram omnibus, dicens: Nescio quid dicis.
verses.english: But he denied it before everyone, saying: “I do not know what you are talking about.”

verses.latin: Et cum exisset januam, vidit eum alia ancilla, et ait his qui erant ibi: Et hic erat cum Jesu Nazareno.
verses.english: And when he went out to the gateway, another servant girl saw him and said to those who were there: “This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”

verses.latin: Et iterum negavit cum juramento: Quia non novi hominem.
