verses.english: And again he denied it with an oath: “I do not know the man!”

verses.latin: Et post pusillum accesserunt qui stabant, et dixerunt Petro: Vere et tu ex illis es: nam et loquela tua manifestum te facit.
verses.english: And after a little while, those who were standing by came and said to Peter: “Certainly, you too are one of them, for your dialect and accent betray you.”

verses.latin: Tunc cœpit detestari et jurare quia non novisset hominem. Et continuo gallus cantavit.
verses.english: Then he began to curse and swear, saying that he did not know the man. And immediately the rooster crowed.

verses.latin: Et recordatus est Petrus verbi Jesu, quod dixerat: Priusquam gallus cantet, ter me negabis. Et egressus foras, flevit amare.
verses.english: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which He had said: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And going outside, he wept bitterly.

verses.latin: Cum autem mane factum esset, consilium inierunt omnes principes sacerdotum et seniores populi adversus Iesum, ut eum morte afficerent.
verses.english: When morning came, all the chief priests and the elders of the people met together to conspire against Jesus and to put Him to death.

verses.latin: Et vinctum adduxerunt eum, et tradiderunt Pontio Pilato praesidi.
verses.english: They bound Him, led Him away, and gave Him over to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

verses.latin: Tunc videns Iudas, qui eum tradidit, quod damnatus esset, paenitentia ductus, retulit triginta argenteos principibus sacerdotum et senioribus,
verses.english: When Judas, who betrayed Him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he regretted what he had done and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders,

verses.latin: dicens: Peccavi, tradens sanguinem iustum. At illi dixerunt: Quid ad nos? tu videris.
verses.english: saying, "I have sinned by betraying innocent blood." But they said, "What is that to us? You take care of it."

verses.latin: Et proiectis argenteis in templo, recessit, et abiens suspensus est.
verses.english: So Judas threw the silver into the temple, left, and went and hanged himself.

verses.latin: Principes autem sacerdotum, acceptis argenteis, dixerunt: Non licet mittere eos in corbonam, quoniam pretium sanguinis est.
verses.english: The chief priests took the silver and said, "It is not lawful to put this money into the treasury, since it is blood money."

verses.latin: Consilio autem inito, emerunt ex illis agrum figuli, in sepulturam peregrinorum.
verses.english: They conferred and bought the potter's field with the money, to be used as a burial place for strangers.

verses.latin: Propter hoc vocatus est ager ille, Ager sanguinis, usque in hodiernum diem.
verses.english: Therefore, that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.

verses.latin: Tunc adimpletum est quod dictum est per Ieremiam prophetam, dicentem: Et acceperunt triginta argenteos pretii quem aestimaverunt filium Israel,
verses.english: Then what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled: "And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one whose worth was set by the sons of Israel,

verses.latin: et dederunt eos in agrum figuli, sicut mihi mandavit Dominus.
verses.english: and they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me."

verses.latin: Iesus autem stetit ante praesidem: et interrogavit eum praeses, dicens: Tu es rex Iudaeorum? Dicit illi Iesus: Tu dicis.
verses.english: Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked Him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus said to him, "You have said it."

verses.latin: Et cum accusaretur a principibus sacerdotum et senioribus, nihil respondit.
verses.english: But when He was accused by the chief priests and the elders, He made no reply.

verses.latin: Tunc dicit ei Pilatus: Non audis quanta adversum te dicunt testimonia?
verses.english: Then Pilate said to Him, "Do you not hear how many things they are accusing You of?"

verses.latin: Et non respondit ei ad unum verbum, ita ut miraretur praeses valde.
verses.english: But He did not answer him one word, so the governor was greatly amazed.

verses.latin: Per diem autem festum consueverat praeses populo dimittere unum vinctum, quem volebant.
verses.english: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release for the people one prisoner whom they wanted.

verses.latin: Habebat autem tunc vinctum insignem, qui dicebatur Barabbas.
verses.english: At that time they had a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.

verses.latin: Congregatis ergo illis, dixit Pilatus: Quem vultis dimittam vobis: Barabbam, an Iesum, qui dicitur Christus?
verses.english: So when they had gathered, Pilate said to them, "Whom do you want me to release for you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?"

verses.latin: Sciebat enim quod per invidiam tradidissent eum.
verses.english: For he knew that they had handed Him over because of envy.

verses.latin: Sedente autem illo pro tribunali, misit ad eum uxor eius, dicens: Nihil tibi et iusto illi: multa enim passa sum hodie per visum propter eum.
verses.english: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, "Have nothing to do with that righteous man, because I have suffered many things today in a dream because of Him."

verses.latin: Pontifices autem et seniores suasere turbis ut peterent Barabbam, Iesum vero perderent.
verses.english: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus put to death.

verses.latin: Respondens autem praeses, dixit eis: Quem vultis dimittam vobis de duobus? At illi dixerunt: Barabbam.
verses.english: The governor said to them, "Which of the two do you want me to release for you?" And they said, "Barabbas."

verses.latin: Dicit illis Pilatus: Quid igitur faciam de Iesu, qui dicitur Christus? Dicunt omnes: Crucifigatur.
verses.english: Pilate said to them, "Then what shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?" They all said, "Let Him be crucified."

verses.latin: Dixit eis praeses: Quid enim mali fecit? At illi magis clamabant, dicentes: Crucifigatur.
verses.english: The governor said, "Why? What evil has He done?" But they kept shouting all the more, saying, "Let Him be crucified."

verses.latin: Videns autem Pilatus quod nihil proficeret, sed magis tumultus fieret, accepta aqua, lavit manus coram populo, dicens: Innocens ego sum a sanguine iusti huius: vos videritis.
verses.english: When Pilate saw that he was accomplishing nothing, but rather that a riot was starting, he took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, "I am innocent of this Man’s blood; see to it yourselves."

verses.latin: Et respondens universus populus, dixit: Sanguis eius super nos, et super filios nostros.
verses.english: And all the people answered, "His blood be on us and on our children!"

verses.latin: Tunc dimisit illis Barabbam: Iesum autem, flagellatum, tradidit eis ut crucifigeretur.
verses.english: Then he released Barabbas for them; but Jesus he scourged and handed over to be crucified.

verses.latin: Tunc milites praesidis, suscipientes Iesum in praetorium, congregaverunt ad eum universam cohortem:
verses.english: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole cohort around Him.

verses.latin: et exuentes eum, chlamydem coccineam circumdederunt ei.
verses.english: And they stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.

verses.latin: Et plectentes coronam de spinis, posuerunt super caput eius, et calarnum in dextera eius: et genuflectentes ante eum, irridebant eum, dicentes: Ave, rex Iudaeorum.
verses.english: And they twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and put a reed in His right hand; and they knelt down before Him and mocked Him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!"

verses.latin: Et exspuentes in eum, acceperunt calarnum, et percutiebant caput eius.
verses.english: And they spat on Him, and took the reed and began to beat Him on the head.

verses.latin: Et postquam illuserunt ei, exuerunt eum chlamyde, et induerunt eum vestimentis suis, et duxerunt eum ut crucifigerent.
verses.english: After they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him and put His own garments back on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.

verses.latin: Exeuntes autem, invenerunt hominem Cyrenaeum, nomine Simonem: hunc angariaverunt ut tolleret crucem eius.
verses.english: As they were going out, they found a man of Cyrene named Simon, and they forced him to carry His cross.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in locum qui dicitur Golgotha, quod est Calvariae locus.
verses.english: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, which means Place of a Skull,

verses.latin: et dederunt ei bibere vinum cum felle mistum: et cum gustasset, noluit bibere.
verses.english: they gave Him wine to drink mixed with gall; but after tasting it, He was unwilling to drink.

verses.latin: Postquam autem crucifixerunt eum, diviserunt vestimenta eius, sortem mittentes: ut adimpleretur quod dictum est per prophetam: Diviserunt sibi vestimenta mea, et in vestimentum meum miserunt sortem.
verses.english: And when they had crucified Him, they divided His garments among themselves by casting lots. This was to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet: "They divided My garments among themselves, and for My clothing they cast lots."

verses.latin: Et sedentes, custodiebant eum.
verses.english: And sitting down, they were guarding Him there.

verses.latin: Et inposuerunt super caput eius causam ipsius scriptam: Hic est Iesus, rex Iudaeorum.
verses.english: And above His head they put up the charge against Him, which read, "THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS."

verses.latin: Tunc crucifixi sunt cum eo duo latrones: unus a dextris, et unus a sinistris.
verses.english: Then two robbers were crucified with Him, one on the right and one on the left.

verses.latin: Praetereuntes autem blasphemabant eum, moventes capita sua,
verses.english: And those passing by were hurling abuse at Him, wagging their heads

verses.latin: et dicentes: Vah, qui destruis templum, et in tribus diebus aedificas: salvum fac temet ipsum. Si Filius Dei es, descende de cruce.
verses.english: and saying, "You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross."

verses.latin: Similiter autem et principes sacerdotum illudentes cum scribis et senioribus dicebant:
verses.english: In the same way the chief priests also, along with the scribes and elders, were mocking Him and saying,

verses.latin: Alios salvos fecit, se ipsum non potest salvum facere: si rex est Israel, descendat nunc de cruce, et credemus ei.
verses.english: "He saved others; He cannot save Himself. He is the King of Israel; let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in Him."

verses.latin: Confidit in Deo: liberet eum nunc, si vult eum: dixit enim: Quia Filius Dei sum.
verses.english: "He trusts in God; let God rescue Him now, if He delights in Him; for He said, 'I am the Son of God.'"

verses.latin: Idipsum autem et latrones, qui crucifixi erant cum eo, inproperabant ei.
verses.english: The robbers who were crucified with Him were also insulting Him in the same way.

verses.latin: A sexta autem hora tenebrae factae sunt super universam terram usque ad horam nonam.
verses.english: From the sixth hour until the ninth hour, darkness came over all the land.

verses.latin: Et circa horam nonam clamavit Iesus voce magna, dicens: Heli, Heli, lema sabacthani? hoc est: Deus meus, Deus meus, ut quid dereliquisti me?
verses.english: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, "ELI, ELI, LAMA SABACHTHANI?" that is, "MY GOD, MY GOD, WHY HAVE YOU FORSAKEN ME?"

verses.latin: Quidam autem illic stantes, et audientes, dicebant: Hunc Eliam vocat.
verses.english: And some of those who were standing there, when they heard it, were saying, "This man is calling for Elijah."

verses.latin: Et continuo currens unus ex eis, et accepta spongea, implevit eam aceto, et inposuit calamo, et dabat ei bibere.
verses.english: Immediately one of them ran, and taking a sponge, he filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed, and gave Him a drink.

verses.latin: Ceteri vero dicebant: Sine, videamus si veniat Elias salvans eum.
verses.english: But the rest said, "Let us see whether Elijah will come to save Him."

verses.latin: Iesus autem iterum clamans voce magna, emisit spiritum.
verses.english: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and yielded up His spirit.

verses.latin: Et ecce, velum templi scissum est in duo, a summo usque deorsum: et terra mota est, et petrae scissae sunt,
verses.english: And behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom, and the earth shook; and the rocks were split,

verses.latin: et monumenta aperta sunt: et multa corpora sanctorum, qui dormierant, surrexerunt.
verses.english: and the tombs were opened; and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;

verses.latin: et exientes de monumentis post resurrectionem eius, venerunt in sanctam civitatem, et apparuerunt multis.
verses.english: and coming out of the tombs after His resurrection they entered the holy city and appeared to many.

verses.latin: Centurio autem, et qui cum eo erant, custodientes Iesum, viso terraemotu, et his quae fiebant, timuerunt valde, dicentes: Vere, Filius Dei erat iste.
verses.english: Now the centurion, and those who were with him keeping watch over Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that were happening, became very frightened and said, "Truly this was the Son of God!"

verses.latin: Erant autem ibi mulieres multae a longe, quae sequebantur Iesum a Galilaea, ministrantes ei:
verses.english: Many women were there, looking on from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him.

verses.latin: inter quas erat Maria Magdalene, et Maria Iacobi, et Ioseph mater, et mater filiorum Zebedaei.
verses.english: Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto, venit homo dives ab Arimathaea, nomine Ioseph, qui et ipse discipulus erat Iesu.
verses.english: When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.

verses.latin: Hic accessit ad Pilatum, et petiit corpus Iesu. Tunc Pilatus iussit dari corpus.
verses.english: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him.

verses.latin: Et accepto corpore, Ioseph involvit illud in sindone munda,
verses.english: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

verses.latin: et posuit illud in monumento novo suo, quod exciderat in petra. Et volvens saxum magnum, ad ostium monumenti, abiit.
verses.english: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the entrance of the tomb and went away.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi Maria Magdalene, et altera Maria, sedentes contra sepulchrum.
verses.english: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.

verses.latin: Altera autem die, quae est post parasceven, convenerunt pontifices et Pharisaei ad Pilatum,
verses.english: Now on the next day, which is the day after the Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered together with Pilate,

verses.latin: dicentes: Domine, recordati sumus, quod seductor ille dixit adhuc vivens: Post tres dies resurgam.
verses.english: and said, "Sir, we remember that when He was still alive that deceiver said, 'After three days I am to rise again.'

verses.latin: Iube ergo custodiri sepulchrum usque in diem tertium: ne forte veniant discipuli eius, et furentur eum, et dicant populo: Surrexit a mortuis: et erit novissimus error peior priore.
verses.english: "So give orders for the tomb to be made secure until the third day, otherwise His disciples may come and steal Him away and say to the people, 'He has risen from the dead,' and the last deception will be worse than the first."

verses.latin: Ait illis Pilatus: Habetis custodiam: ite, et curate, sicut scitis.
verses.english: Pilate said to them, "You have a guard; go, make it as secure as you know how."

verses.latin: Illi autem euntes, munierunt sepulchrum, signantes lapidem, cum custodibus.
verses.english: And they went and made the tomb secure, and sealed the stone, along with the guard.

verses.latin: Sero autem sabbati, quae illucescit in primam sabbati, venit Maria Magdalene, et altera Maria, videre sepulchrum.
verses.english: Late on the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.

verses.latin: Et ecce terraemotus factus est magnus. Angelus enim Domini descendit de caelo, et accessit, et revolvit lapidem a porta, et sedebat super eum.
verses.english: Suddenly, there was a great earthquake, because an angel of the Lord descended from the universe. He approached the tomb, rolled back the stone, and sat upon it.

verses.latin: Erat autem aspectus ejus sicut fulgur, et vestimentum ejus sicut nix.
verses.english: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing was as white as snow.

verses.latin: Prae timore autem ejus, conturbati sunt custodes, et facti sunt velut mortui.
verses.english: Because the guards were so terrified of him, they were terrified and became like dead men.

verses.latin: Respondens autem angelus, dixit mulieribus: Nolite timere vos: scio enim quod Jesum, qui crucifixus est, quaeritis.
verses.english: The angel spoke to the women, saying, “Do not be afraid. I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

verses.latin: Non est hic; surrexit enim, sicut dixit. Venite, et videte locum ubi positus erat Dominus.
verses.english: He isn’t here. He has risen, just as He said. Come and see the place where the Lord was lying.

verses.latin: Et cito euntes, dicite discipulis ejus quia surrexit: et ecce praecedet vos in Galilaeam; ibi eum videbitis. Ecce, praedixi vobis.
verses.english: Then go quickly, and tell His disciples that He has risen. He is going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see Him there. Behold, I have told you.”

verses.latin: Et exierunt cito de sepulchro cum timore et magno gaudio, currentes nuntiare discipulis ejus.
verses.english: So the women left the tomb quickly, with fear and great joy. They ran to tell His disciples.

verses.latin: Et ecce Jesus occurrit illis, dicens: Avete. Illae autem accesserunt, et tenuerunt pedes ejus, et adoraverunt eum.
verses.english: Suddenly, Jesus met them, saying, “Greetings!” They approached, held onto His feet, and worshipped Him.

verses.latin: Tunc dicit eis Jesus: Nolite timere: ite, nuntiate fratribus meis ut eant in Galilaeam, ibi me videbunt.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brothers to go to Galilee, and they will see Me there.”

verses.latin: Iis autem euntibus, ecce quidam de custodia, venientes in civitatem, nuntiaverunt principibus sacerdotum omnia quae facta fuerant.
verses.english: While they were on their way, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.

verses.latin: Et congregati cum senioribus, consilium accepto, pecuniam copiosam dederunt militibus,
verses.english: When they had assembled with the elders, they took counsel and gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,

verses.latin: dicentes: Dicite: Quia discipuli ejus noctu venientes, furati sunt eum, dormientibus nobis.
verses.english: saying, “Tell everyone, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we were sleeping.’

verses.latin: Et si audierit hoc a praeside, nos faciemus eum fideles, et vos securi faciemus.
verses.english: And if the governor hears about this, we will persuade him and keep you out of trouble.”

verses.latin: At illi, accepta pecunia, fecerunt sicut docebantur. Et divulgatum est verbum istud inter Judaeos usque in hodiernum diem.
verses.english: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been spread among the Jews to this day.

verses.latin: Undecim autem discipuli abierunt in Galilaeam, in montem ubi constituerat illis Jesus.
verses.english: The eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had instructed them to go.

verses.latin: Et videntes eum, adoraverunt: quidam autem dubitaverunt.
verses.english: And when they saw Him, they worshipped Him, though some still doubted.

verses.latin: Et accedens Jesus,loquutus est eis, dicens: Data est mihi omnis potestas in caelo et in terra.
verses.english: Jesus came near and spoke to them, saying, “All power in the universe and on earth has been given to Me.

verses.latin: Euntes ergo, docete omnes gentes: baptizantes eos in nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti,
verses.english: Therefore, go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit,

verses.latin: docentes eos servare omnia quaecumque mandavi vobis. Et ecce ego vobiscum sum omnibus diebus, usque ad consummationem saeculi.
verses.english: teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And remember, I am with you always, even until the end of the age.”
